	<button type="button" class="bbCodeSpoiler-button button--longText button" data-xf-click="toggle" data-xf-init="tooltip" data-original-title="Click to reveal or hide spoiler" id="js-XFUniqueId286"><span class="button-text">

		<span>Spoiler: <span class="bbCodeSpoiler-button-title">Superheroes</span></span>
	</span></button>
	<div class="bbCodeSpoiler-content">
		<div class="bbCodeBlock bbCodeBlock--spoiler">
			<div class="bbCodeBlock-content">Superheroes: Men and women with extraordinary powers fight crime and disasters. And malefactors with powers of their own. The genre is dominated by two corporations with vast kitchen sink settings.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CwYNzG-hnRDSsCz7XamP7IzT-agC4pzc/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Amalgam Comics</a> Short lived minis, mostly one title, giving glimpses into the aftermath of the Marvel vs DC event, a fused universe where, for instance, Bruce Wayne became the director of SHIELD while the mutant Logan stalks the shadows of New Gotham as the Dark Claw. Anthony Stark uses the technology of an alien starship, ring and battery to build life-sustaining armor, the Iron Lantern, and so on.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bCz_yF6W2XtAFsRhqCmLcccGc4ui8MoN/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fanfiction</a>, <a href="https://docs.google.com/file/d/1WDeD7IBK8RM0NralZfPeNZWQnwmCH39z/edit?filetype=msword" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Going Native</a> (Dragonball Crossover, asshole Saiyan SI).<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/10S_Vu5V4zNl21AZflj8kL55jQ8Yg5ToR/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Atomic Robo</a> comic, 120 years after his creation by Nikolai Tesla, Atomic Robo leads a team of action scientists to explore the world and keep it safe.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qhz5PuFsuXFTfQ582q3hKC-GfTbWbg-T/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Authority</a> a very hands on team that eventually takes over the world.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AP6u7Q8EacFmiAZ0a2dvlpl8D1krK7zU/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Boys</a> show, previously <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uk87eGCaHjdIFi8ZcPvYkQREyhKTsazc/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">comic</a>, with a CIA black ops capekiller squad knocking off messed-up pastiches of well-known heroes.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GmkE91bw_lAWyDgg44HznK5_HsBt7GMR/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Charlotte</a> Two siblings go a school for kids with powers, the sister dies in an accident. Griefstricken, her brother gathers all the powers to himself before going back in time to change it.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1d9IzHv5ZsOYfrGdukWlcCZABCp7300M-" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">City of Heroes</a> MMO where you play as a hero/villain in Paragon City, struggling to rebuild after an alien invasion. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1d0Ldl__r8atsw5AhgRdlMDh3Ox7EJK9K/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Going Rogue Gauntlet</a> Praetoria, the mirror universe version of Paragon City where the heroes are either villains or fascist totalitarians.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CoYqF0dL2NC03ox-KELxxVhrfcvTZ8Zp/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Darkwing Duck</a> superhero parody cartoon.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GTHeD81tKSRkMlla7uNdRdWeeTxsxfGF/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Double Cross</a> a plague turns some into supers, others into monsters.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nPZgmbiIuYM3CSbgFoFTn9SPzNmYCRx4/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fine Structure</a> A rationalist sci-fi web-novel about tech that breaks the apparent laws of physics, which change over time. Several people get powers, most prominently, one person a year gets struck by lightning and gets flying brick powers, going into a berserk rage for just under 16 seconds. Each of these 'Powers' is twice as strong and fast as the last.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1E8ipr7ogb_PSgxO1BrbbJA_YoSLyj1jD/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Grrlpower</a> Webcomic, self-aware superheroes focused more on character and humor. Comics nerd Sydney Scoville has orbs that grant her powers, and is recruited by ARC, the government agency of supers.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Oh0WrJf5Rk22QbODFrdy9CoYJX0GbFWQ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Huck</a> Mark Millar comic about a small town in Maine that hides the fact their developmentally-delayed gas attendant is a flying brick who can find anything, and tries to do at least one good deed for the community every day. Until a newcomer blabs to the press and we get supervillains and mad science all up in Huck's once simple and carefree life.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Vt5taq1tzoWotAAIvcaPGisWSt5bcIsd/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Incredibles</a> a family of supers tries to hide out after supers have gone out of style, but hunger for the glory days and so get lured out by villains in two separate films.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jUxny1QOs5TY-l3VtzRNmNbSfcaIwYiC/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Invincible</a> Mark Grayson gets superpowers from his father the alien Omni-Man, secretly a brutal warlord from a race of basically super-Nazis.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ssGG3GPX6twZGKdZHdZf2pS2clYoqZ3h/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Legion of Liberty</a> RPG, Superheroes of the American Revolution. One in a few thousand people born in the Americas develops powers during puberty. The British conscript supers into a special elite Regiment, the Sons of Liberty have spent years sheltering and training their own Legionnaires. Mostly you do small commando raids or cover your forces against hostile supers.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hne7ZShaaRl1NM614Az37GW__NXx2Zhs/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Megamind</a> movie, a supervillain finally destroys his nemesis, Metroman, tries to create a new one and winds up making a worse villain than he'd ever been. Time to see life from the other side.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hne7ZShaaRl1NM614Az37GW__NXx2Zhs/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Miracleman</a> comic, Michael Moran leads an ordinary life only sometimes troubled by dreams of superheroics. In truth, he is, or was, Miracleman, one of five supers created using alien technology with vast reality-warping powers. Unfortunately, his one-time sidekick Kid Miracleman has become the thing their makers always feared.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zyOrH9YdUZBEz0q1rx5oHebh6PPXIs-x/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Miraculous Ladybug</a> Two young teen French supers have romantic issues in and out of costume, while fighting a villain who hands out corrupting powers to others.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/18M8AIJVvdVISku_kGY_lM-7-dfC9dQg2/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">My Hero Academia</a> superhero school anime. In a world where 95% of people have some kind of power (or 'Quirk') Izuku Midoriya is born quirkless, but it turns out the world's greatest hero has one that can be transferred, inducting Midoriya into a lineage of heroes. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/14Wr1Fg2kxiJuORaCUxuVCnJBXra0xpUY/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">One's Justice</a> is an MHA fighting game.<br>
- <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lGSF6yXFL9NJ0MtLvtSoBmuITD5VYrIjBEd7tzbCf-8/edit" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fanfiction</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RK0TDhIG9q8mWGG5jNa99qeMTnVerlr_/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">One Punch Man</a>, Saitama is the world's strongest hero, though unacknowledged, and thoroughly bored with the lack of challenge. He can take down any foe with just one punch. A comedy about finding meaning in life. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mT7nwUmsO_e16DUtRYuvIXZJjEVo_LU1/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">A Hero Nobody Knows.</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1z6E1O1C0fln4Oo4ywKzWviaVQoE_enR6/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Paragons</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1l99nTxns4PWKcOMobqeyedBQwqRHM0Q7/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">PS 238</a> a grade school for kid superheroes.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hGhDQjL3XEjoaJ_Bu7vmp-HT6f0P1wIy/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Phantom</a> comic, part of the bridge between traditional pulp heroes and supers, like Zorro, &amp; the Shadow. A masked hero protects the jungles of Bangalla, a man whispered to be immortal, but in truth part of a lineage of heroes.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pQ3100PtsWGv92XBhj7c_AiQ507umILo/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Reckoners</a> books, superhuman warlords carve up the world between them, no heroes to be seen all with powers are corrupt. The titular Reckoners assassinate what Epics they can.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/16JDDsDU5CxZWKdJt5hSqtaOSrjVb7fBQ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Rippers</a> (via Masked Crusader origin) Victorian monster hunters graft monster bits for a needed edge.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CGyrhXV7sskFF9PsC1fRVfLd4_SLTuR0/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Shadow</a> Classic pulp hero, this jump is for a miniseries.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jUY-9DqdmMFCvLnS33k89kNlGVAjK29A/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Supergod</a> deconstruction, super-soldiers become as gods, a decades-long secret arms race that goes hot when India's super, Shiva, decides to depopulate India to save it and everyone sends their own supers in.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RZgiwWH4nwMYe2BbnSTX3taIEaJqdNzl/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Super Powereds</a> Five teen Powered - those with no control over their powers, undergo radical treatment to become Supers and go to school.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/13O1meQNf8FOhngKwVG6iA3EKoJRzs7Yp/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Superhero Movie</a> The Scary Movie people make a parody of the Spider-Man, X-Men and Fantastic Four movies, as usual stuffed full of references no one will get or care about in six months.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QCzqn_syog03m-LutLchdGJlXLl9G4Lf/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Uber</a> In the final days of WWII, a German general unleashes hundreds of super-soldiers, and three nigh-invincible human battleships capable of destroying all they see. As the war grows ever bloodier, the Allies scramble to produce their own Ubers.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DuwGLQ4EpDz1AW-SZWV98OW_D6cg1cff/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Watchmen</a> Former supers investigate the murder of one of their own, find conspiracy for world peace. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OlyaCAXh19cRs23qQyEJrONvWLWgAH7b/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Movie version</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rwZXAElCEVDeaPWw4CQoRFYGn1W3CnQo/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Wearing the Cape</a> books, Hope Corrigan is caught in a terrorist attack, has a breakthrough and becomes the flying brick hero Astra.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ZKV45w3RF5_tqws_UF2wxyr01-4VhvLR/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Worm</a> bullied teen girl Taylor Hebert gains bug control powers and joins a supervillain gang, originally as an infiltration, then in earnest. In a world with shadowy conspiracies, a roving gang of powered serial killers, and semi-regular kaiju attacks. Also a looming apocalypse.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YJ_g_ato4LmwADfZCYAGsZQ3-Jcp-2AU/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fanfiction</a>, also <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Srk_LrKaNah-Bm-0NsVoSSHIgFKet8sW/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Revenge of the Son of Generic Worm Fics</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-1db5GUPEPWI5SgM4QWcqHCY9khslt_y/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Ward</a> sequel to Worm. The world was saved, the world was destroyed. Victoria Dallon is one of many trying to pick up the pieces of her life and deal with new threats. Including murder cults, shadowy conspiracies, her sister and people turning into worse Kaiju than before. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/17ldbZ8m6Fp-QX0O3IIvQV1umg7xtja_p/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Joke Jump.</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1tRNWtoZ9slI8V03eixqWS5lF0pFZrD0j/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Endbringer</a> Be the overpowered Kaiju.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cjW9EmdRJqs4kUjdCSU_vDKpmQNfSe9z/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Entity</a> Be one of the godlike aliens handing out superpowers like party favors and blowing up worlds.<br>
<br>
<u>Generics:</u><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/15GBAj26aUxvRI-Jm7817--eO1iCRA07U/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Superheroes</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wCWzrmoG8WCPIkA810eQTYA1M8hu5evx/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Super Academy</a><br>
<br>
<u>Capepunk</u> - "grounded" superhero stories, generally with hoodies and leather jackets standing in for colorful costumes. Almost always about the very first superheroes in the setting and usually lower-powered. Examples: Gladiator, Kickass, the Umbrella Academy.<br>
<br>
Alphas (via the <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0By8NY-NO4-N5N055b0FjcEZWdTQ/view?resourcekey=0-z-sruCrbV4yGtVQ5Xxm5gQ" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">SyFy Shared Universe</a>) Powers are the result of neurological differences or edge cases of human ability, resulting in people who are amazing at pattern recognition or have a mesmerizing voice or perfect aim, maybe temporary super strength, but extremely street-tier. Dr. Lee Rosen assembles a team/therapy circle to investigate the mysterious Alpha terrorist group Red Flag.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yQPd1_A6qVLdroJcmivfoTTnZxifKaDo/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Chronicle</a> Four high school students explore a weird cave, get telekinetic powers. One has a terrible home life and eventually snaps, killing with abandon.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1e1l0-Up0gxSKnnMCuUXg4PdYaB5Jsa84/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Eastrail 177 trilogy</a> (Unbreakable, Split &amp; Glass) A man discovers he is invulnerable and super-strong, mentored by a man who becomes the first villain, the mastermind Mr. Glass. Later another man with Hollywood DID has a superpowered persona.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fiHE9fCdhhoxEEi6l8Ld3VKZcl1T1RoZ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Hancock</a> There's one super (actually one other, in hiding) but he's a drunk and something of a public menace. Until one day he saves a PR guy who vows to clean up his image.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_TH0sswbFSIWkpFeTh2TFRYeTQ/view?resourcekey=0-aAn_YEkMDP7HV4tsW0xILQ" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Heroes</a> vast conspiracy surrounding supers, several people around the world get powers and have to come together to save the day, and resist the power-stealing serial killer Sylar.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/10rHHh8VTo5qNvo07V8-jRdvH7qbBLs6u/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Infamous</a> Cole is a bicycle courier who transports a mysterious device called the raysphere, which explodes and gifts a large number of people with elemental Conduit powers, including himself. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/12eYSOgcxpw-gX1vm1SxmYSTxS80AcGCA/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/12-2QRhHrR5Rs1-0ISGOQFlcOxLhbUbRT/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Jumper</a> A young teleporter fights terrorists, while opposed by the NSA who want to force him to work for them. Also has a <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MNu_JIfnTn7gJQpa3NtiHERap3U6pYep/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Movie</a> where he is instead a thief being stalked by religious fanatics who... just hate teleporters?<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1VePgYp1V-vql5xOvU88LPWhmiiBfJEWO/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Lucy</a> A woman is recruited as a mule for an intellect enhancing drug, winds up far smarter and more powerful than anyone could have predicted.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Hh-Uns-uAw_7u1YYTYiE_Q9UoxWQUlKh/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Project Power</a> A shady PMC starts dealing superpower-granting drugs, Power, in New Orleans. A vet seeks his daughter, kidnapped to be studied and harvested for power, the sister of a dead dealer is looking for answers, as is a bulletproof cop.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_JHdTiZosxIbP-V5BccUFxmaIAz7gD_R/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Prototype</a> Alex Mercer was a terrible human being who unleashed a deadly plague, but he's dead now. Consumed and replaced by the Blacklight virus, this earth-born version of the thing must flee Blackwatch and try to contain the spread before somebody tries nuking New York.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dnCSxbyWZW_RvO_c7U9ad1i3NcYZ_WRk/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Push</a> Psychics have been around for decades, and governments have been secretly running horrific experiments on suppressing/enhancing their powers for about as long, sometimes sparing a few useful bird-dogs to hunt down more psychics. The protagonist is a fugitive telekinetic who is enlisted by a precog to rescue his ex who was the first success in vastly enhancing her mind control powers, escaped and is on the run.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/13eToewgZthpCP9LpR3Qt-IFdgWeK3uDa/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Secret Return of Alex Mack</a> Bit of an edge case. After years of hiding her powers per her Nickelodeon show, and taking part in a multiversal crisis event, Alex decides to become her world's first superhero. It's very grounded, but there are also tights and flying and military support. Also basically every sci-fi horrorB-movie ever is also going in the background.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TG7maSHTOm_d4mkgXWwvQ-HPnIqlfRYW/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Sidekicks</a> in a world where Sidekicks are heavily abused apprentices to superheroes, Dream Girl serves the greatest hero Darkslug (yes, really). However, a shadowy villain, Metheus, strives to pull down the whole rotten system, mostly as a side effect of his plan to obtain the orbs that grant all powers.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1tr0QI9RHdnrN4MwPCtOzgYBO6LR1Hvbp/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Sky High</a> Disney Channel movie. Will Stronghold is the son of the two greatest superheroes, but initially lacks powers when sent to a high school in the sky, with a harsh hero/sidekick divide. Originally dismissed as a sidekick, he gets powers and fame, lets it go to his head, then discovers who his real friends are when the villain Royal Pain appears to... turn all the heroes into infants and raise them to be evil. That's a long-term plan.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1j9iAOSlDNj2sFCBdD34PFWctWtc2us4y/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Smallville</a> with a <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1P0fYwjJ6SiTdUQOymEFft8Y_HBKcUy7K/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Reddit version</a>. DC comics as Capepunk, Clark Kent is a high school student/young man trying to conceal his vast powers, while dealing with a parade of people who get powers and immediately turn murderous.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qrBGM4kyNiesB_k291pxYf44FXk9LL63/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Umbrella Academy</a> comic, now show. 43 simultaneous virgin births, seven of these children were purchased by an eccentric retired adventurer who raised them to - more or less - superheroes.<br>
<br>
<u>Detective Comics:</u> Makers of superhero stories since the 1930s. Most famed for their trademark characters Batman and Superman. In 1985 they famously did a top-down reboot of the whole Universe, the Crisis, to patch over plot holes, nerf Superman and the Green Lanterns and make things more interconnected. If there are any pre-Crisis Jumps, I haven't seen them.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qcC-O58hSf8qM71wtpgrmvF-V1LnbVgO/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">DC Comics</a> and <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qcC-O58hSf8qM71wtpgrmvF-V1LnbVgO/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Collaboration</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yZv1hFwxm9sj4pgl_xuvIGw4mlD0A4IZ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fanfiction</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UdOttF7fQ__3EWfyNnlCPKs6t0XihDxt/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Arrowverse</a> A linked continuity of a bunch of 2010s DC shows, Arrow, the Flash, Supergirl, Legends of Tomorrow &amp; Batwoman. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sEjX1DW9ymln8k8iZROAIPjDSlwVdQcC/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Reddit version</a>.<br>
<br>
Batman. After watching his parents gunned down, little Bruce Wayne becomes a ninja-detective and wages a one-man war on crime. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kUhcsqdspgQ4IHUCN4tCf_pX_FJC_Ymg/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Animated</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/16FGsdNNtB9ND10_jEgqdHaF_icBatRgo/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Nolanverse</a> &amp; <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hqbSPC1TLjGI0iMR4u-QyTlvsBF7SC7I/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Batman cartoon</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sSljAM3kU-FvSW066uSyiF9buWohL07o/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Batman Beyond</a> years after Batman retired, Terry McGinnis takes up the mantle.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/15yHh4amuFDEmEpu6I-ot0N0FnS0IXmTl/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Arkham series</a> a fun group of Batman games, including the original <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wqrEqQr-aBfPe7ssrhozI576TtJfkqXa/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Arkham Asylum</a> and the ending <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1p8dWDOw6YeY-DLjmBPkXqpQSkwI7zWK6/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Arkham Knight</a>. Now <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ODYK09agVbhvdMdCFmI-tvDu7OcoLJW0/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Gotham Knights</a> where the Bat-family rally after Batman is murdered.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aAQFl0xi7JK_XOjdWCnAb3bN-8vadsBW/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Versus the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GYPRibNDJ1MbOrXAxdxr5KSG3Js9V0zr/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Earth 2</a> for the longest time, the continuity of the old 30s and 40s comics, the WWII/Golden Age heroes. Now, a mini that rebooted that universe, where the heroes of the present (Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman etc.) died fighting off the forces of Apokalips, and new heroes rise to take their place.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/15RV_mec0SJJq0l6oRSIv-hWUVUAVROJN/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Earth 11</a> The distaff Earth, just like Earth One, but everyone is the opposite sex. Batwoman, Wonder Man, etc.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OyZp-Ovl-Ak9-qRy2yZ7H68N3_mEm-MG/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Earth 18</a> a cowboy Earth, hosting both the twenty-odd Western titles DC used to put out, as well as several characters as they would be in a more rustic setting.<br>
<br>
DC Animated Universe (DCAU, or Timmverse) 90s cartoons. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kUhcsqdspgQ4IHUCN4tCf_pX_FJC_Ymg/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Batman</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RKPCx7DbRSPgjCrh7X07Q_kWmwm685ps/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Superman</a> and <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1SURY98B1wJF3KXh_kCAeq8sTv8xfRyVP/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Justice League</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ZKifOSVeu6tJCeUGFz_nuUbOLZwnZmo-/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">DC Expanded Universe</a> (DCEU) 2010-20s films. Darker! Grittier! Colorless and sad! All the things you love, right?<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1k-mmTGpStVtNr4Lg6UpeklfIaDlKyRpe/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">DC Universe Online</a> MMO, as Brainiac invades a future Luthor comes back with thousands of 'exobites' able to give people powers and skills they would have developed now, creating countless new heroes and villains to be mentored and led by the old guard against the alien menace.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1NaXVo6-c8U-H9fknagm-xyx3ID7oPXMb/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">DC Occult</a> the magical side of DC.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hCj6OxSX2yhFBvPyjegEtpjDJHPvSaqy/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Justice League Dark</a> the team of mages the League assembles to handle the spooky side. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1NQ2bK-Rss0GJsP-JnrgGC0MFxgFrdvb9/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Reddit Version</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/17Ab9Q1DuT7Btzyf0OpIwZRHXbCXjraq0/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Fourth World</a> Jack Kirby's New Gods.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CMrCd_gA4IQwG31dw9riZvFiG3vchrzE/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Gen 13</a> government experiments produce superpowered teens they hope to break into agents.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1iSDvKQsFejyLvdHBpDkJ_Y6dDBvXVDgD/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Golden Age</a> The WWII-era DC heroes all cope in differing ways with the post-war, obsolescence, middle-age, McCarthyism and one last plot to stick Hitler's brain into a pseudo-Superman.<br>
<br>
Green Lantern - A human (think we're up to six now, actually) is recruited into a corps of space-cops, all using a hypertech ring that can do practically anything. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jw9pdmykkYspErx0P8NwiGUtE6RiDwON/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">movie</a>, and <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/14HBmA98XTREPiYK7LnA4q22kylH2Aqx5/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Animated Series</a>. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1duSJnkTiDoIhWPwnxQW16S_Pjj0CHJLl/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Blackest Night</a> one of the darkest (heh) storylines, where black rings start raising the dead all over the universe.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1setCscW_S0d_PBAKAbysv01cVMMJkFLT/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Larfleeze</a> comic about the only Orange Lantern, powered by greed.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hAloDvhG_Y75Ps20jBpq769g9BdYD2sS/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Harley Quinn</a> irreverent cartoon about the Joker's henchgirl (herself conceived as a metaphor/lesson in abusive relationships) strikes out on her own and assembles her own team of ne'er-do-wells.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/149_dow-hD5H_R2A_ax93TOrjAOCQ0gHj/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Hellblazer</a> self-hating, blue collar wizard John Constantine protects the world from demons and eldritch horrors, and occasionally angels. Usually by tricking them into fighting each other, or sacrificing a dear friend. Also got a movie, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jx4Hoh323jz_8X9o9M7CjxGk2R1RFycv/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Constantine</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/176qx9ga1d0huI3gltiDA0qIu4yCa1l8o/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Injustice</a> cool fighting game, with a nonsensical comic (and animated film!) to justify the premise. The Justice League are transported to a parallel universe where Superman rules the world as a bloody-handed dictator, most of their counterparts eagerly at his side. See, the Joker tricked him into murdering his pregnant wife and trigger a nuke that destroyed his city, and he killed the Joker and so became evil. Batman leads a teeny resistance of non-powered scrubs <i>and one of the people who set up that scenario.</i><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1N25rznpc2tf2zqkOBs1XRQ-K1a-hpcaS/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Kingdom Come</a> a dark future where the children of Silver Age heroes engage in endless petty turf wars until Superman and the old Justice League emerge from retirement to police them, much to the distress of governments.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1XUZ-VAOpTVchbn3f9KQQxN6WyVZ8dOKi/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">League of Super Pets</a> movie in which Superman's dog Krypto assembles a team of various pets with powers to save the League, from a housepet with powers.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hn8FWBz8mQ8hPo8-cru6hymQR6ZrKhEa/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Lucifer</a> same Image imprint as Hellblazer &amp; Sandman, the devil takes some time off to run an LA nightclub and fight crime.<br>
<br>
Superman. Last survivor of a doomed planet, gifted godlike power through sunlight, but at heart just a fundamentally decent person. One of the first people you thought of when you saw the word 'superhero' and for good reason. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Tu_QMUu_C3AaWhlIrZQSmmuqnFjOoJSL/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Movies</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1fYLr1Ov5-rQXltsbLk8vzK-pAHT-dwuP" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Animated Series</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CjarMGNiABEUA0NIV1-0zzyRsp-mSW31/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Man of Steel</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MoI0AbzIvuA_DEa2GVdcqHYuQOMk785C/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">All-Star Superman</a> dying of a sunlight overload, Superman strives to leave a legacy.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1H_rjK1HoL8439Xrms2lS_DMHX0nkUBK6/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Red Son</a> what is the rocket (or time capsule) was twelve hours earlier or later? What if Superman grew up Russian, and fought for Truth, Justice, and the Global Communist Revolution?<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1j9iAOSlDNj2sFCBdD34PFWctWtc2us4y/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Smallville</a> prequel TV series, showing his growth from high school (very Buffy-like) and beyond.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TLA6bJ6-S53pHp9jSXWMc3sAwDmXsfCJ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Teen Titans</a> cartoon of an old comic about a team of sidekicks, which did get interesting characters and storylines of its own.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1t_Vez-ZSSwd8qM73C1Wq4o9cI0uSCfPE/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Young Justice</a> series drawing as much from Teen Titans as its namesake, the sidekicks of the Justice League form their own training team, which is also used for extra-covert missions. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1h-KftVpruFdZY2hnFfr9OE7gi8Yqg74F/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Reddit version</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GbVnZ1Qh59nLfLM6UUzJ-OA8H_jN69rP/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">With This Ring</a> self-insert fanfic with an Orange Lantern.<br>
<br>
<u>Marvel Comics:</u> Originally Timely Comics, then Atlas. Marvel Comics made it big in the 1960s by releasing titles with far more focus on character and mature themes, with flawed and struggling heroes. It's a formula that has served them well to this day. Best known for Spider-Man &amp; the X-Men, at least previously. In 2009, the company was purchased by Disney. Since '08, they've become the largest name in superhero films with an increasingly vast and interconnected web of movies and shows, the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU).<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ki-POww152RRG_iptIHqu_k3y7RTbZeC/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Marvel Comics</a> The base jump, early work and really basic.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IofpjUqqymErGPh8nAvl8gr-wMvQP3Gp/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fanfiction</a> in general, specifically there's <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zq7wUiV8Li1D-lzYIW1AWxlbW32g7Tuh/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Variant Strain</a> a crossover between Spider-Man &amp; Prototype.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BA7_3hOEP3NVOYgmhDbsGE9MkgAFfdcD/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">MCU</a> the ongoing extremely popular film franchise. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zGjtRIOusHtOY5nnC0wUM-Jss_WtWIcR/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Volume 2</a>. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/15cFSCppRjGgG-qZ7rH24a22JORhih0J8/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Reddit</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1c_6Yvct1E_oLyjFkAPwVumb7xFoV-NV9/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Defenders</a> the low-rent heroes of the Netflix TV shows. Daredevil, Luke Cage, Iron Fist &amp; Jessica Jones.<br>
- Phase 4: <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1a5mYztlPF18hlRHUr2AuqaKy3IAdIDHB/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Doctor Strange 2</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RVuS6pVWV4rLho08dASJIE4HrwdiHN16/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Loki</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AHCu4p311qhdcQjWXanScwNgMUToWG0R/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Thor 4</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/10hKA-372M5kZN-EeBlfsBMBIHMkCjKRb/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">She-Hulk &amp; Ms. Marvel</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ODdgCjh7EGFhyrFQUU4AGa-czKOOhtcC/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Moon Knight</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Mooy6wtv62ERHxiUZps1rzX8iYXWMQuk/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">What If?</a> explore many variations of how things could have gone in the MCU.<br>
- Fanfiction, includes <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QyWQ2XLwxVLcZsZaqklFURguxajv4cHZ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Marvellous Dragonballs</a> a Dragonball crossover.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AMXfXqME68Q6w8cuzwFZhIJNrnPB8I7E/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Avengers: Earth's Mightiest Heroes</a> the premier team, also a cartoon.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1SdQc6YI8cXs89saZreKAMya2Kp2CA8Im/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Avengers Vs. X-Men</a> a deeply stupid event pitting heroes against each other for sales. So a worse Civil War.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/19EsSUNy-9NF3K8O5aJlC8D4R9uKfvgUy/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Blade</a> Marvel vampire hunter. Half-vampire himself, his mom was bit during delivery, he takes a serum to suppress his bloodlust.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_yIPK2nQcZQJ5lWWKAeNvwmxXSCQsomk/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Britain</a> Y'know, there are English superheroes. Like the teams Pendragon and Excalibur - okay, that last was more than half X-Men and doesn't seem to be a part of this, except for Pete Wisdom, MI6 mutant.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/18NoGqTj5Oo0EUiGrkCtydnDSniJvfqK-/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fantastic Four</a> the world's smartest man launches himself and his friends/family into space with inadequate radiation shielding (kinda says a lot about his intelligence). Instead of dying, they gain powers and become sci-fi costumed adventurers, the Fantastic Four!<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pizKrzw87RP9SEV1pIJASI_qQqiE8cT9/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Future Fight</a> gauntlet/game a fighting tournament in colliding universe, in a time loop. Have fun!<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/14CzCl9ltlrzr9pTbZ0z3RsKsgRmnfknB/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Galacta</a> mini-series in which the daughter of the ol' World-Devourer tries to show she isn't like you, dad. Dieting is hard when surrounded by food.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hkOsLZPN87g2WNHht3FHGA2KMR_U1Uhs/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Ghost Rider</a> Johnny Blaze made a deal with the devil, who could have forseen it going poorly? Now bound to a fallen angel (ish?) he lives as a stunt rider by day, supernatural avenger by night.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fmrLeLcfXI4lH2pwP0IWq1W7ohMzFw-W/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Heroes Reborn</a> the 90s reboot of <i>half</i> the Marvel titles, everything but Spider and the X-Men (shut up about the mutants, they're in a whole 'nother universe now!). Darker! Grittier! All the things you love!<br>
<br>
Hulk. Dr. Bruce Banner is irradiated saving a teenager from his gamma bomb, and now turns into a huge green rage monster whenever threatened. You wouldn't like him when he's angry. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rqKdwJj98mH5YaMeNdhNJbHpbJrIkmz1/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Indestructible Hulk</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1S4wLsTC0m0T2awW3zkmZhdNioycrSapc/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Planet Hulk</a> &amp; <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jOLoF8oLCXo7BfehotlWihr9QoTjVnzE/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">World War Hulk</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1XHGTlbOowO2WEbvZaXqHw0DauEUcuyfm/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Kid Heroes</a> One of the many tiny tots of terror.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ILA4cT3_jeWy_TwQdUcM8-knsIvf25Pu/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Magic</a> sorcerers and gods, explore the supernatural side of Marvel.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kNW-rYCb6YKbeHhMperyhuYnTrdYlXit/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Marvel 2099</a> in a cyberpunk future, the legends of Spider-Man and the X-Men inspire imitators, while Doom from the present is sent to the future.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ZgWTDXo6Ft7_ubjUKq0cOQvcn2ue0vTS/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Midnight Suns</a> when Hydra raises Lilith, the mother of demons, the heroes must revive her child, the Hunter foretold to bring light despite their darkness, in this XCOM-like tactical game.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_z9zD7pLRSB4tL2LQP3vUT8ptYHg_maF/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Morbius</a> Spider-Man villain, tries to cure cancer, discovers vampirism. Now a widely-panned movie, I confess I haven't seen it.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aQ-rAzSyMPQZmylsln95-XA0liOZSzQe/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Pet Avengers</a> The cutesy animals (and Lockjaw!) of superheroes.<br>
<br>
Spider-Man, Peter Parker was bit by a radioactive Spider, let a burglar go who shot his uncle, and now fights crime. His life is usually a shambles, but he takes the hits with a grin and goes on helping people. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AaKF2e1OrPN5BqthIXVFnZ8UveWDBR2w/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Raimi movies</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oJWuqp9pHAHgLywp5x2Bqd5ePgpWpWqj/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Amazing movies</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AaHi2rXDXWNJrTY0Juk0jcC0WDnTUtNL/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">PS4 game</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/18-8LEHvbjOXR-9MMKfhV9DamBybGRxoY/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Animated</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Q3U7LPlZGYdmue9lxd8l-P_f_LcTq4AC/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Ultimate cartoon</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IyA_jHK8EkBWvle-fRn4cCJqMaqfDsfL/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Spider-Verse</a> Spider-Men from across the multiverse must band together to survive the Inheritors, multiversal energy vampires with a taste for animal-themed empowered.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YYju7woYYb3Ag_LaaGOc72YRv82zfYTb/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Into the Spider-Verse</a> nothing to do with the comic above, but a movie about Peter's Ultimate universe successor, Miles Morales.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zq7wUiV8Li1D-lzYIW1AWxlbW32g7Tuh/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Variant Strain</a> Prototype crossover fic where Peter gets his powers from a virus.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sYFEM1813YI9GqgnCacuPorCh_Tg1njV/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Super Soldiers</a> Much good has come of the military trying to make supers, see all of Captain America. And a whole lotta bad, see any other time super-soldiers come up.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qSJHEw964WwVkBq1tVIGaMrO1EPfkD1H/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Symbiotes</a> aliens want to get, uh, really close to you.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Qpl3wmBdb2dSqVHJ6K_TYlG2zdrmhmwX/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Venom</a> movie about Venom, somehow without Spidey.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ERSqTKLgrWmeJnqX8Y_CVi7FALHYZt1H/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Venomverse</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1XkUeOoD-wY0IJazYJFu9tl579GoY5JXN/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">X-Men</a> a school is made a hidden refuge for mutants, superpowered stand-ins to whatever oppressed minority you care to project onto them, and from here a team goes out to protect a world that hates and fears them. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1z29Gmruu1CeRnlPTyICqeN--ozUf4r85/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Movies</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_1Z1ig_GeRw5rPIg_wFX_SaVEUsyThGV/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Evolution</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1R5C37ZQ5yPhrjpI-1Y1myUGbwTRWIgbj/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Krakoa</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ROJD2_w1ZDXGnmlOvLNvE77O2Xrmc-dg/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Ultimate Marvel</a> the early 00s reboot. Darker! Grittier! All the stuff you love! Now Cap is a racist, Ant-Man is a rapist, Hulk is a cannibal, the X-Men are all assholes (Wolverine the most of all) and Magneto's due to end the world. At least Spider-Man is still a good person, but he also has like forty years worth of nasty shit dumped on him in the last two years of high school, and dies. Don't go unless you love marinating in pointless darkness or bringing the light with a blowtorch.</div>
		</div>
	</div>

<div class="bbCodeSpoiler">
	<button type="button" class="bbCodeSpoiler-button button--longText button" data-xf-click="toggle" data-xf-init="tooltip" data-original-title="Click to reveal or hide spoiler" id="js-XFUniqueId287"><span class="button-text">

		<span>Spoiler: <span class="bbCodeSpoiler-button-title">Science Fiction</span></span>
	</span></button>
	<div class="bbCodeSpoiler-content">
		<div class="bbCodeBlock bbCodeBlock--spoiler">
			<div class="bbCodeBlock-content">Stories focused on future possibilites, more science and technology focused. Maybe the invention of an incredible gadget, a story that uses a futuristic setting, or one that explores the implications of tech and how it will either make life awesome or doom us all.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JfRjorm859vj7IITlMTNTRL5E6MvBTFh/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">A Princess of Mars (Barsoom)</a> Civil War veteran John Carter is whisked away to the fantastical world of Mars, Barsoom in the local language.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jAX4Hbg_pu9EKnoDhKE5o6uomvy__Pgg/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Alpha Centauri</a> humanity colonizes the nearest star system, but break up into seven factions.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qTn_YwqQ3gEuY10Rla7kEfqA_Ch8PHTd/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Andromeda</a> Captain Dylan Hunt is frozen in time for hundreds of years, awakening to a dark age after the Commonwealth fell, he enlists a crew of scrappers to try and rebuild.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ekvAjIV2voyu-bf_dUwEspdmgPt1GQKR/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Anno 2070</a>- Takes place on an island-sized, submersible super-vessel called the ARK, in a future where climate change has led to rising oceans.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mbz1G5B4SYJ7aJ9tPrwu9wxo2XAUSSwa/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Anthem</a> shooter as colonists relic hunt on the ever-shifting death world of Coda.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HjKq8jlyhFdgf3PNiHeAslGND7iW8Poo/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">ARIA</a>- A futurist, utopian slice-of-life on the city of Neo-Venezia, a recreation of Venice built on Mars after the planet was terraformed and made into the water-filled world of Aqua. While the tech on Neo-Venezia is intentionally low due to residents' preference, there are still spaceships, floating cities that stabilize the weather/climate, and even subterranean facilities to manage the planet's gravity.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/10S_Vu5V4zNl21AZflj8kL55jQ8Yg5ToR/view?usp=share_link" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Atomic Robo</a> - Doctor Atomic Robo Tesla, action scientist and leader of Tesladyne. A superhero series that's more grounded and with better continuity than others.<br>
<br>
James Cameron's <a href="https://www.docdroid.net/ZTc61fu/james-camerons-avatar-v1-pdf#page=12" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Avatar</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1isgoZL-Su_MBCSehfYfmRt_eDnIgzsev/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG</a>) Humanity colonizes the nearest star system, in search of a miracle metal, but have rocky relations with the primitive natives since we keep killing them and taking their stuff. Jake Sully is a marine remote piloting an alien body for diplomatic purposes, but must choose his loyalties.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Xg-DgizT_p0_4c7GD86QHZlaJxijLpm8/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Babylon 5</a> after the Minbari almost wiped out humanity, a space station of interstellar diplomacy is built. Well, four failed ones, leading to Babylon 5. Nice place, but be careful. Nobody here is ever what they seem. Jump ain't great, so I'd use <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0By8NY-NO4-N5TGcteDNpdjlMUHc/view?resourcekey=0-93JBm2bXzC3nEXDHfQZpYA" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Crusade</a> a spinoff where Earth has been infected with a deadly plague that will take time to adapt to our physiology, a starship desperately questing for a cure, but with scenarios where you can go sooner.<br>
<br>
Battlstar Galactica - show from the 1970s and 2010s reboot, the Twelve Colonies are wiped out by their onetime robotic servants, the Cylons, with a single warship escaping, protecting a refugee fleet in search of the lost colony of Earth.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1h8nuwTTLgJzkzxW4gVc4bmy1_Hta1r24/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">nBSG: Deadlock</a> strategy game where you fight the First Cylon War.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1i2ZLqXVp5HHV9RHr62XuQsa9Bjxo5Xue/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Chobits</a>- Focuses on Personcoms: robotic computers that resemble humans.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/13NFYShu0zhW8b38fAoiBBFckwWL_4lSw/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Civilization: Beyond Earth</a> a successor to Alpha Centauri, colonize an alien world.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qVtdqAGkPV014Cs_pKsVEPvwKYL1TDUt/view?usp=drivesdk" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Creeper World 4</a> - A science experiment goes wrong, involving a trip across the universe fighting against the relentless blue goo of the creeper.<br>
<br>
The Culture - Ian Banks' ideal society, liberated as can be, post-scarcity, run by benevolent AI <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_mucOf-cgxwSxFR2xJ1FrXaQ9u_J1Inh/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Minds</a>. While others exist on the <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1L2lpqUSNk_w4zSqglkd_ueuICwkoK7v6/edit" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Bioscale</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oZc4EM7eEyGj7nP4Zb-DKMJw4I_Froux/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Doctor Who</a> alien time-traveler explores the universe as a tourist, often helps out. (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1puCdp8hRPpfUgp8OzsARIh8Ramru2qyU/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG</a>)<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DwHk0QzsQRCPJB2-u-l0F2xHlaUliZxm/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dune</a> The chosen one, Paul, comes to the desert planet of Dune, and will lead a crusade to become ruler of the universe and a multigenerational drama. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/140CJVzZM8a3aLtj3lN96D8JRuTokcd2n/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a>.<br>
- Also inspired some hit strategy games. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DwHk0QzsQRCPJB2-u-l0F2xHlaUliZxm/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Emperor, Battle for Dune</a> and <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FpzrUDp6V_tS4ZQi8mfBjF9oMZq0VOYf/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dune 2/2000</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MsZ0OROPy6pVrUPSNmng9WM7YPl4hpcx/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Endless Space</a> strategy game.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Zw9OF8xIGAdF--eOVZUa0guadsAU5JF5/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">EYE Divine Cybermancy</a> Absolutely bonkers half-finished shooter game with neat powers.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1VazHvGpNj38TdKgZBMkcVPe_NQ9drpjT/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Demon Princes</a> Kirth Gersen is a rare survivor of a world hit by the pirates and warlords collectively known as the five Demon Princes, now grown and out for revenge. Each book Kirth infiltrates a new Prince's homeworld, spends some learning of the culture and his quarry, so he can use their flaws to lure them into a trap or ironic punishment.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/19YzWzatRUzAwaQZ_TCIDejzOyBqI9IKK/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Firefly</a> Space Western/heist stories a crew making al iving on the margins of society after a failed revolution.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1eNMr_UJRveKxs81qsyaGnF8eNb_VH1qr/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Flash Gordon</a> pulp comic strip, athlete Flash Gordon, and Dale, are kidnapped by a crazy rocket scientist, Hans Zarkov, to the rogue planet Mongo to prevent it from destroying the world.[/URL]<br>
<br>
<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1CQa0PWA7MPBAxEriFJg3HDDMAjZ089-eRycWF40Y8IE/edit#heading=h.snrfi0wm9qaa" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">For the Tyrants Fear Your Might</a> Replicators unmake capitalism.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1SNRfQF_WX5NoAUZgkLHv6bOfU-VpOHKo/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Fountain</a> generation-spanning slice-of-life.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1XxnghVS9Joi343uKUXz4UXRFVLU8F0JH/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Galactic civilizations 2</a> I think it's a Master of Orion style 4X, never played it.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1LRunxgX3neHvQbgMhF-nfGYf48MsnotW/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Galaxy Quest</a> Star Trek parody movie, real aliens abduct the cast of a Trek-like show, to a duplicate of their starship, and expect them to save them.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xujRNrx4pqjmcVvK5xYg3aDJVpYwE1g0p7Oi7-VFGOA/edit" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Hardspace Shipbreaker</a> you're a working breaking down ships to pay off your debt while having to pay the company for gear, air, etc. Supplement mode allows use in other settings (e.g. actual Shipbreaking on Kharak...)<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ops1m2dt_v_KtkBKG_EsX37SHKfpZwxv/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Heat Signature</a> four factions fight over a hostile nebula.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OxcozEgeOXv6V4ztdjiERtZ7va5s6R0E/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy</a> The end of the world is just the beginning, as Arthur Dent encounters the most unlikely of people and situations. This is a weird one so keep hold of a towel, and don't panic.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/10bx8aY9e6D9gJMBJvhqxPcrDCot1kOp-/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Homeworld</a> Kharak develops an FTL ship, is almost immediately destroyed for violating their imprisonment to the system. The mothership begins an odyssey in search of their people's original homeworld, Hiigara. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1VLzePhu9w6JL1SlG2poxyunkAJgMR_Za/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a>, and a ground-based game, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hBXw2fzrBdjIw-ZVSu8Qc1DUSOLDGIGt/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Deserts of Kharak</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://www.docdroid.net/IZ439SZ/hyperioncantoswip4-pdf" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Hyperion Cantos</a> pilgrims go seeking a wish, and exchange stories about the dire state of the galaxy.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-rvxpe3o6mT_gtaWJBXbKTL-bkY5yHli/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Infinity</a> RPG, humanity has spread across space, but is divided into seven ideological factions bitterly opposed to each other.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UQXphrwKLgN__0KPG0Jsr6FFcV79L-Sx/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Iron Giant</a> What if a gun had a soul? A ruthless war-robot develops a conscience.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/19l3Ex14LKnKKgxtCGmu5hzJI03pthW-j/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Jupiter Ascending</a> The universe is ruled by an aristocracy that seeds planets with life and then harvests them for an immortality serum, and Earth is next. Fortunately, Jupiter Jones is the sort-of reincarnation of the queen of the universe.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GDFGPQx_jqnOICtGrcZ08yfernwAXFtK/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Kinsmen Universe</a> Future humanity has spread across the stars, are ruled by a genetically engineered and often superpowered aristocracy, with steamy romance filled with passion and danger.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aeOGfVvrjPlqJuZF0uyExIUu4qOiCmcQ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Lensmen</a> the galaxy are all catspaws of immortal aliens, but more immediately, psychic cops and warriors prop up Civilization.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Jkiime5N5HZHwx0q3Tv6wvYVr6hgdPSITx94d1azkng/edit" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Lodland</a> Earth is frozen over and several undersa civilizations are making a living. Also supplementable on basically anything.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/12FnCw4UKWxdFUedZayBICpUhKvAbVBYB/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Lord of Light</a> trippy sci-fi where a colony goes transhumanist/Hindu gods.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1z1nDiCBhKv8vf_DhWcuBiV2lg2w4hFEV/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Mass Effect</a> About an elite operative, the first human Spectre, in a setting where giant robotic space squids roll in every fifty thousand years or so and cull advanced civilization. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B1qb0_OLhDrDaExLaFB1eF8zTHc/view?resourcekey=0-6lVjvaA9La1O-YiIaZrkBg" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1subT4btSs5wr_UL1UCuSWiaUkjcQJSZK/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Legendary Edition</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Gm1BiKTgXa1WymQ0eO179JYOC1FK605Q/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Andromeda</a> spinoff where the ME races colonize the Andromeda galaxy.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_d0AdA8suAtx3sCiqyZIL2Gth3LZBgyn/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Blasto</a> the man, the meme, the legend.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mTKT0VSD6IFTV85ZHOdV0nsOPiURqhaJ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Reaper Hunter</a> Crossover fanfic where Earth is a lot closer to the Monster Hunter world than anything else.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xmt-Cwi5LsRfJGLR6ZOsEPW7q-VDygPg/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Matrix</a> The robots rebelled and won, reality is a shared simulation, except for one tiny resistance group, praying for a chosen one.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ljxWlS3_NK423McH2JUvi5rZ6Hgpuyn2/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Orville</a> A starship gets awkward when the captain's ex-wife becomes the XO, in an affectionate Trek parody.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xWCXj7WNls3atSwJTg77Tcu_ZuQVeSmF/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Outlaw Star</a>- An anime where pirates and criminals rove the stars to reach their dreams.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rHJ4D7PvBq1lqx6zErVhnEg7I7dhA4sE/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Out of Cruel Space</a> Space Opera HFY where humans evolved without magic contrasted to the rest of the galaxy. And most aliens are 99% or more women with enormous physics defying mammaries who can't get enough of Earthmen. Can't forget that part.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_kBaqKMFvX9g1V3MX-F8iAcnxRQ_ZeN_/view?usp=drivesdk" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Particle Fleet</a> - Gauntlet. A fleet travels into dangerous space in search of technology<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1K5SCmlVXqNy5XxE66VeOBFVic-oTw117/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Pikmin</a>- A space explorer adventures across an alien world (that's probably an extreme future Earth).<br>
<br>

There was some resistance, but they got to be an example of God's Wrath. Night City is the probably the last city, torn between gangs and megacorps. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OHRlid1TUQg3ga1wR4eBpOleKYaABUtQ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a> and <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EkO6CygOsuLt2QUQcnMnvW4OJAzHDocP/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Edgerunners</a><br>

<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ycsrJOygADkl-WgSSEJSAwCSO8INGxEG/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">VA-11 Hall-A</a> A game where you run a bar in a cyberpunk dystopia.<br>

<u>Gadget:</u> Exploring the consequences of a possible invention.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mi2ybGwSyceuRmVn4oMIrraXGugxZ-1U/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Clone High</a> drama with cloned historic figures going to highschool together.<br>

<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1o6DtUeZ3o0PMqLXbqOi6idR0WOvOh6qD/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">I Have A Mansion in the Post-Apocalypse</a> A kid discovers a device that transports him to an advanced, but ruined,<br>
world.<br>

<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Y8DpkCDaOq2BWNA7uhWkni62aiXR5hKn/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Ready Player One</a> The founder of the VR internet leaves his fortune and admin privileges to whoever can complete a series of easter egg hunts based on 80s nostalgia.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1P7ToEQsjiNhOoc39MFfnNWVlt-8IHKqC/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Total Recall</a> a mars vacation gets complicated thanks to memory-altering tech.<br>

<u>Hard:</u> (mostly) scientifically accurate.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cTwec2U2c983NGzzWr55dKf6I8f8W4X4/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">A Miracle of Science</a> - Webcomic. Mad science has allowed the colonization of the solar system, and the Vorstellan Polizei protect the system from mad scientists. Ace Vorstellan cop pursues one such egomaniac with the help of Caprice Quevillion, a psychiatrist and part of the Martian hive-mind.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lf5Z6Alv9_zsry8H4x-oSJImBIId5Pty/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Altered Carbon</a> Future where a hard sci-fi default aristoracy of the rich and ageless has formed.<br>
<br>
Bobiverse: a Von Neumann probe based on the brain scans of a 20th century man slips it's program, goes multiplying and exploring the universe. Two jumps for being an <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OUUKVxuGEUTCgkU02VU6WjK8WN4iY_CsKrONZJ7iMHM/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">"Ephemeral"</a> biologic, or <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fyrgA1KLi6sdKrR-ZoRNAXyXe1PrIOKbRlkYMqvQOmk/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Homo Sideria</a> as the Bobs name themselves.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uUbWNSdOn9Ic9BYEBRxH0qJ3_5D96aIg/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">COSMOS</a> edutainment program brought astrophysics to a generation.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OvxbfXlRW5hB-et-rMlgCZivBGdjyxpm/view?pli=1" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dyson Sphere Program</a> Sim game where you must build a Dyson Sphere and ship a certain number of power units to Earth. Scales are compacted a lot for convenience.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1H7aqfo-Y6kovhr2ElDOVSuJRnaUC86Ah/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Expanse</a> The transition from system-confined hard sci-fi to grandiose space opera isn't easy, as humanity is threatened by an alien disease which eventually connects them to a vast interstellar portal network.<br>
<br>
Orion's Arm - an attempt to write a 'totally hard' (ha!) sci-fi setting, tens of thousands of years after AI, nanotech and transhumanism really took off. Two jumps so far, one for the civilized <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WOD5E3eue8BNRGU2C_l5o3e3Hs1AsEYq/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Sephirotic Empires</a> ruled by benevolent AI gods, and one for the local version of the Borg, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1r6HpaC4638xLe3OfxVO2fNtWPv49NtO1/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Amalgamation</a>,<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lAoZHtdnfv4xLpeGUnej99-ImpYtBCPX/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Science &amp; Futurism</a> Series of videos exploring hard sci-fi concepts.<br>

Or... not.<br>

<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1w4UDvCxahQjboRD8iF7q8xL1CfOV7_Vr/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">AI War</a><br>

Now a single surviving warship escorts a ragtag refugee fleet on a quest to find the lost colony, Earth.<br>

<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ufkKxY1mWYyJ6Pk0jsT7PNTI1RR5_KX0/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Excalibur Alternative</a> aliens abduct a bunch of English knights and longbowmen from the Hundred Years War to fight for them on primitive worlds, they rebel and fly off to form a hidden interstellar empire so one day they can come to Earth's rescue.<br>

<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1D8qBObMCKZzyMgZkp1efTsUMNyXKwuWr/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">In Fury Born</a> an elite commando loses her family, bonds with an ancient spirit of vengeance, as well as the AI of an experimental warship she steals to pursue her vendetta against the pirates.<br>

<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bQhIQSUxhh6MB8xH2cDOmHVwgpQ4tQKV/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Halo</a> Humans are attacked by religious aliens, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1SYPZ4trSksT-KEW6ajFtLK32uFCUkgF2/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">the Covenant</a> who hope to follow their gods, the <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Sa0YiTsiRqbtEejVoMKTdyqPgxRjQrnz/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Forerunners</a> to paradise using the titular devices - which actually kill everyone in galaxy to contain a sapient super-plague, the Flood.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B1qb0_OLhDrDM195MXpodEMtTkk/view?resourcekey=0-tBDrs9D9GCwn03pKrIuhWw" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Gauntlet</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QN_KU1B1mDdGsm5buMx3UX--O4jtJRlW/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The High Crusade</a> A scoutship of the Wersgorix Empire lands in 1345 England, and is utterly overwhelmed by the locals who attempt to fly it to France, but their one alien captive activates the auto-pilot to take them home. So the village of Ansby conquers the Wersgorix and a thousand years in the future their descendants are reunited with the Earthlings.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RWLrg8ZoRJx22zEcPokuZYFYgsASqg7l/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Honor Harrington</a> Brand new captain starts a daring career just in time for the Napoleonic Wars in space as Haven (Space France) menaces Manticore (Space England). <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WAOC_Xanc-jn4ay-BPLDd9Fq-VnkHQd1/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kP52aBK0OWUj7-2SsMMbokvSR2GGyw2y/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Hostile Waters</a> The world is a utopia, but some people can't let go of nationalism and militarism, now a single last warship is all that stands between the new world and destruction.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1c51CKe-Fc5qSQ464aSo-o1BJm8gU_cTE/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Last Starfighter</a> Kid gets a high score on an arcade game, which is secretly a test for the Starfighter Legion, protectors of freedom and democracy throughout the sector.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PeRr0SXTP19HB_coQVPJKtyHXi6DtITb/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Legacy of the Aldenata (Posleen War)</a> Aliens warn us that Earth is in the path of the Posleen, ravenous alien horde. So they give us some stuff to bleed them for it.<br>

<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1iiFE1vSGLwYWop7t78bYuyQQlvLZWrAV/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Legend of the Galactic Heroes</a>- An epic space opera covering the long war between the Free Planets Alliance and the Galactic Empire.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HdvNOVEUAAUmI3b-QHJWPkzbH2KB-Bv1/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Leviathan Trilogy</a> WWI but with steampunk robots and genetic engineering.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CHq7NMJDfB0CM6S_kbUkNVCdDQc1jMqk/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Lost Fleet</a> Captain "Black Jack" Geary is attacked and kept in stasis by a lifepod, only to be revived a century later and find the war is still ongoing and all the officers on his side are idiots with the tactical sense of glory hound berserkers. He is taken on a disastrous assault and has to pull the remnants out to safety.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/15kEeQEfMTol6hri47f2Fi2aQMeC832eA/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">March Upcountry Gauntlet</a> Prince Roger and his battalion of Marine bodyguards must walk across a hostile jungle planet to a spaceport and discover if the attack that stranded them was a fluke or part of a general coup.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1z3f2NNKHqnWMehG7ftwLK3_gc8F5NJ1-/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Mutineer's Moon (Empire from the Ashes)</a> Colin MacIntyre is an astronaut who discovers, to his shock, that the moon is actually a spaceship, humanity descended from it's crew which had to abandon thousands of years ago due to a mutiny. Now the stalemate between the moon and mutineers must be broken because the aliens they were searching for are coming in force.<br>

- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rOgAcfzQSfuKpfTp6O50553_76WsbaIv/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Robo-undead</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WgRahLbKQAiXzQvMq70JifThh9CWiKk-/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG</a>)<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Sr5aBt5_--vG4pYeJ9deN_V3fJWxKgVQ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Bugs</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qI7YXvgg_nUAZ8BQJkbGTYcIEqPiPgxv/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Space Dorfs</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1iUPdYWQIz4HYm5xIfeM4xTAHg_3UUD64/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Space Weebs</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/10P881j-3prf6pTXdiJy4kHl9JtGb2hdQ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Assorted Aliens</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1X1dO3dIuDgBv-wg8FZsSlj4qnJRch11G/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Warp</a> &amp; <a href="https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1kdnpRW3_7eALRF4EWlWLT8ch8xzOH0UK" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Black Crusade</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Kt3MYUFvm79Tx7FKPmeZZeJIR82dm5Hf" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Light of Terra</a> Early endjump gauntlet, kind of funny.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1W2yaHW62OY1_h1GkXbVlFegrTl7Ixu6c/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Primarchs</a><br>
<br>
<u>Steampunk:</u><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wd1AZNgucITLCR7rmACdb9yDGLla82ar/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Girl Genius</a>- Mad scientists run rampant across Europe in this steampunk comic.<br>
<br>
