<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/19-gN0v_HzjKa8SZoZri2MIOkbjdHeJ-V/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Glass Scientists</a> Henry Jekyll wants desperately to bring mad science into the mainstream. Just so long as there's no scandal involving, say, an unleashed id.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/10kqYzQq0bo2wjznkTKopQJhM6AjkTGZi" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Lost Valley of the Dinosaurs</a>- Based on a bunch of the 19th/early 20th-century sci-fi adventures like Jules Vernes' works and Arthur Conan Doyle's Lost World, as well as similarly styled adventure films like The Land That Time Forgot.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PCoc-7Jy6GODmih2io3AWzjowZcmylX4/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Trails in the Sky</a>- Technology has sharply advanced due to a special kind of power called orbital energy.<br>
<br>
<u>Time-Travel:</u><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bxj-77yYmQbIQrxKE0vnEkz0hCamjU5a/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Back to the Future</a> A time-traveling car lets a boy undo his parents meeting, break time trying to cheat at sports gambling, and duel a Wild West outlaw.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oZc4EM7eEyGj7nP4Zb-DKMJw4I_Froux/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Doctor Who</a> Adventures of a time-traveling alien guile hero and their human sidekicks. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1puCdp8hRPpfUgp8OzsARIh8Ramru2qyU/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">tg version</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/19YEWt8FWwDOPumhia_DP0GieSGMf_oS3/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Ring of Fire: 1632</a> West Virginia coal-mining town in 2000 CE, swaps places with a burning village in Thurinigia, Germany in 1631. Also has a toggle to use for any ISOT (time-displaced area) scenario.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/16jquGIagL8z1STKFCUV2KU5v0yZLGeiN/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Stein's Gate</a> A quirky mad scientist accidentally unlocks time-travel, creating a puzzle-box plot.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/129bwgyU9ZO9zIeVDNND6eLfLHSQwgwME/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Terminator</a> A robot from the future stalks Sarah Connor, whose son would one day save humanity from the robot rebellion. From there, things start getting complicated.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ZP_3Bf22g6OeVfYzMyVf_SJo_4waus4g/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">This is How You Lose the Time War</a> Red and Blue are rival time agents leaving each other taunting messages. Eventually, they fall in love.</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</div><br>


<div class="bbCodeSpoiler">
	<button type="button" class="bbCodeSpoiler-button button--longText button" data-xf-click="toggle" data-xf-init="tooltip" data-original-title="Click to reveal or hide spoiler" id="js-XFUniqueId288"><span class="button-text">

		<span>Spoiler: <span class="bbCodeSpoiler-button-title">Urban Fantasy</span></span>
	</span></button>
	<div class="bbCodeSpoiler-content">
		<div class="bbCodeBlock bbCodeBlock--spoiler">
			<div class="bbCodeBlock-content">Gods and monsters of the ancient world never went anywhere, they're still with us. Most, but not all involve a Masquerade where the supernatural is hidden away (Harry Potter, World of Darkness) or maybe a modern or near-modern setting where the magic is out in the open, but you'd better have a license for that unicorn (Bright, Onwards).<br>
<br>
<a href="https://www.docdroid.net/CfCzTOD/generic-urban-fantasy-pdf" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Generic Urban Fantasy</a><br>
<br>
<u>Masquerade:</u><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rL_RMkQT8ZSfO89Nl87Ay7wzl_7SQCcQ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Alex Verus</a> the protagonist, having barely survived apprenticeship to a dark wizard, just wants to run his book/curio shop in peace. Unfortunately for him, his divination magic is in high demand whenever a mystery pops up.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1vRvO75BnkTFan3canB6LMRgCNP09VhQf/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">American Gods</a> - books and a show. Shadow is an ex-con hoping to put his life together, when Mr. Wednesday (Odin) recruits him to raise an army of the old gods against the incursion of the new ones. Naturally little is as it seems.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1B3eD4fz-5-0WVUZ7aF9dcRmLUc_6bdzK/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Artemis Fowl</a> boy genius criminal takes a fairy cop hostage. Then becomes a sort of ally as he's the one person they look up any time the LEP gets baffled or humiliated.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EOKHhT4RxUnKF1EMo5fsA6clYBLM3NFC/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Borrowers &amp; Broomsticks</a> Books by Mary Norton, one involving one of the last practicing witches in England, one a hidden race of tiny people.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oDGNeNBZ8Fi4lcSrD0GOFdWhy6kxctQY/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Buffy the Vampire Slayer</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/116bkFPFCTLPSxHqqTlpcWtOGICNCUSz3/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a>) film and show, in each generation one young woman is gifted the strength, skill at arms and prophetic dreams to stand against the evils that stalk the night. Until this go-round, the Slayer always fought alone.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pRVYXSUDNkhZ8VLDkgUvbou5qrOp8REt/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Charmed</a> Three sisters reunite in their childhood San Francisco home, discover a book of shadows and their powers as witches, not just any witches but the promised culmination of their bloodline, the Charmed Ones who will face and defeat an ever escalating carousel of warlocks and demons while making a complete hash of their professional and personal lives.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/190JVYompBsnskh-9JaI6HxLFSHqRBq0I/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Cirque du Freak</a> Darren Shan and his best friend Steve sneak out at night to see a freak show. Darren steals a tarantula, while Steve recognizes one performer as a vampire, but is rejected for turning. Darren loses control of the spider who bites Steve soon after, and the vampire will save his life only if Darren agrees to become his half-vampire assistant. Be warned this one has a world-ending plot scarcely avoided. So glad I added a prequel toggle to let people skip that nonsense.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/17hXE8GQTro3VxYgYyCFp57XOTNxe2fyP/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Demon Accords</a> Chris Gordon is a rookie cop and secret exorcist.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WVVKQhg0RmB8Ub0qgI13kYt2JKsdpZmr/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Dresden Files</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/12oiXi-7hDA3lgneI5pVKra-cJQDV5SCm/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a>) Harry Dresden is a Chicago PI and the only wizard listed in the phone book. Increasingly intricate mystery plot as he deal with various cases and problems as they come up, before looking into what causes all these disasters.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EBoyYZg7a4q6Nk3Zd9whmekBqNGOZeKl/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Epic</a> Girl is shrunk and gets involved in a fairy conflict.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/19AfLhXnMj-6tHodUc0_vcnMGlX6ryLzs/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fablehaven</a> Twins Kendra &amp; Seth Sorenson spend a summer with their grandparents, whose farm is secretly one of dozens of hidden preserves for fairies, dragons, giants etc. However, there's a sinister cult out to free the trapped demons and conquer the world, so the twins are forced into a series of dungeon crawls to retrieve the five keys to the demon realm, just in time for the baddies to swoop in and take them. Over and over.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0By8NY-NO4-N5NEJoRlNzUEw5cDQ/view?resourcekey=0-P2zdbHN9--8jAjoPDVYulQ" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Gamer</a> Han Ji-Han is granted the ability to level up like in a video game.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/17yjvsFB4biAorcegYaY-FeJzeTW4Zl2K/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Gurps Monster Hunters</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1K1mKzewA01u3mzIqV8lN504rzjytuoo_/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Harry Potter</a> A kid goes to magic boarding school in Scotland. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Nm5bL32FVgCGSeu36i9YunjDmNv-sFaa/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Reddit</a>. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1j0l1oHSHhJCP-CtmZrNvsmsxLz_Bvbbv/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Wizarding World</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1iCAHRyQFRNQhiBYMHkSG7OJQEvk73aJw/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fantastic Beasts</a> a 75-year prequel about the world's least capable zookeeper. Failed attempt to milk the franchise some more.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1b7N-1jFTgPOAd4lJ4IlvwWzUhGN4fupJ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fanfiction</a> and Jumps thereof abound, some of them quite <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Z5bCajCLdfZGgJhsMQBUWiFWzswgccat/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">dark,</a> including but by no means limited to; <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xrcDv5jqe8yUgUg3WPwPlSKQWnT1wl_Y/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">HP &amp; The Natural 20</a> (insert a D&amp;D wizard), <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1q7rHtrcmvOl5KNuBdTEfe1aFMk3LgiRO/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Make a Wish</a> (expecting death, Harry goes on a world tour), <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oP9Iwgl8camGIlJQtjEFqMX8JhX4Y2Cx/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Arc of Sacrifices</a> (Wrong twin-who-lived, magical oathed Harry into his brother's bodyguard), <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AFuWpSDff2TYDIew-vsAr44P1ZLV09X5/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">A Potter's Stigma</a> (crossover with some anime, Kaze no Stigma, I've never heard of), <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Yf3gA5zwNirBVLHhNVRUmSL-8B66h1jt/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Methods of Rationality</a> (what if Harry was a 'scientist' and unbearably smug?), <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WIywuC9yTpNPkjhtNVaCNsqXzxUHS655/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Partially Kissed Hero</a> (What if Harry had Voldemort's memories, but was eviller?), and <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hguPJGyqkl5j6SqEpXz6JII7MdQ4CJui/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">My Immortal</a> (hot goff vmapyre chick goes to skool, gaiz!)<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1SRcZSofJZRqirRsfbD4ASv4Up_XoQEVG/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Highlander</a> secret community of immortals, engaged in a battle royale where each gains the strength and memories of those they decapitate. Holy ground is neutral territory, ever since a duel on sacred Vesuvius, 79 AD. Connor MacLeod has outlived his Scottish clan and so many things. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Xx_7s0vbf_D6Agru_LK1M1r7jc7B67JM/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Animated series</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/19s_eI6mS3ZmoQnUqsZo3hnA7vmcJaKVu/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Iron Druid</a> Atticus O'Sullivan is the last living druid, having spent centuries hiding from his gods after stealing a sword.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AxsYXH0f4oQuHHgotfFlXf9yTh5dTtxT/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">IOU Illuminati University</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/15fkpWF0gq321-4EeKOmQhvHTERodPmUr/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Kate Daniels</a> Another supernatural PI, this time magic comes in 'waves' sometimes magic works, sometimes tech.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/13SLTcZBNVAx0sz_AYTbdEhTv0lDcHnVP/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Keys to the Kingdom</a> From Nothing the Architect constructed the House, center, source and bulwark protecting the Secondary Realms (multiverse) and after eons, disappeared, leaving stewardship of the House to the seven Trustees - faithless servants who broke up the Architect's Will. Earth is a cosmic backwater, utterly insignificant, until one human, Arthur Penhaligon, is named the Architect's Heir.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1d76w8X2OXoiqCo-IHb9wCDgQKK4Afvrg/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Librarian(s)</a> The US Metro Library conceals a far vaster one, containing countless relics of magic and lost texts. The Librarian is a chosen super-scholar who wrangles the artifacts, protected by a Guardian. In the series, they have a bunch more of important roles in the magical world, and more than one comes about.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hfMHIJEEBtTcAbdCRjsHWoWeldCr4bel/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Libriomancer</a> Isaac Vainio is a libiromancer, able to pull items from books, everything from rayguns to magic rings. The leader of his order, Johannes Gutenberg, goes missing, starting a chain of events that will melt down the masquerade.<br>
<br>
The Magicians (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cAGDDxHdw2dAfGuNJ7HAOZXOW1CYV6qt/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG first,</a> <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/19kCF0f6cz8qjdFEBSdm0kdUuOiSzkngy/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG</a>) Harry Potter meets Narnia, meets a bunch of burned out college students.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wsv1PnnEbDse-272qE0e6eAXJKqGJDNt/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Monster Allergy</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1n6RJlZlsZpQwthQlRZtj_uWEllKFu20x/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">October Daye</a> Toby is a half-fae changeling and knight, who is just done with the fairy life after an incredibly abusive childhood culminating in several years trapped in the form of a fish. But as a detective in an occult mystery series, it's never that simple to get out.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nsR3h4T1NbUXmCanY6o7eZ9BCiLwhV0X/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Order</a> secret societies of mages and werewolves clash at a college.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1A-owYPGT4A0pnN4uFgNh6k76bGjiZUmJ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Shadowhunter Chronicles</a> Supernatural romance/adventure, with hot half-angels hunting demons.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RkZhGP33CjWK8cOJWzNvYdm5bkxyFEF2/view?ths=true" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Sorcerer's Apprentice</a> David Stutler unleashed an ancient sealed evil in childhood, but it's cool, he's the Prime Merlinian, the chosen one to become the greatest sorcerer of the age.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1N_xhCK-W_gSmayrqqDbGwhGqBVseiBVv/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">What We Do In the Shadows</a> A sitcom/mockumentary about a collection of vampire roommates, who are mostly weirdos with trouble adapting to the modern world.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RH3V8tJZ2iPK43V2ZqtkFRb2G-Vx7Mfy/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">New World of Darkness</a> The rebooted, nerfed and more unified World of Darkness. Secretly ruled by a vampire Camarilla and the Technocracy. Be a <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1x6BoMo4reEhRXg365AKlBHvg5wdGmJoP/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Mage</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1g79NfyUKLc18_IYiG_Dlwdv7jAh1lEiQ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">2nd ed.</a> or even <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1VrrU4gdExVfzgPQFxjkGPZ1IbxXm2YaC/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Archmage</a>), <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OqUYebUDoRltwNQCkAVhQzz64tVj1HEP/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Vampire</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qjYj5mMMAy3GoSWbwEvLHoIbDXGDXTQc/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Werewolf</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1tuDgIV37vHOg9RMWdp77ytge2slsvWOx/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Mummy</a> or <a href="https://www.ecosia.org/search?q=promethean%20the%20created&amp;addon=firefox&amp;addonversion=4.1.0&amp;method=topbar" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Promethean</a> a golem or artificial person.<br>
- fan splats like <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aeUckE_F1TMdUpZRZfDReSkWikwXv7IL/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Beast</a> and <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cNxN5wENvSH85wUS1kP4mnQPsvxMNg_q/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Princess</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jqZkzAC5VPxjHJ8PE3Tn9HbWPQNXh1m4/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Old World of Darkness</a> classic urban fantasy RPG. Play as a <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0By8NY-NO4-N5RlY1S3NPUTFIZXM/view?resourcekey=0-yL3KrmlMGuPeS8qxcjz65A" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Mage</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BwQDrIaldcqMRFpJRWlMMDQxa0k/view?resourcekey=0-LliHNkl1hXGvh0Z-gdhVuQ" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Panopticon</a>), <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rdPW3mjEqOCdocXghWhFPoGqnu5t9p3J/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Vampire</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Fg0mz-fOhVYdBc54HUNJw-S-o9wZxK5a/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Kindred of the East</a>), <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B9z8OBNwez4nZFFmV2RTRGdydXM/view?resourcekey=0-UllFvj1CG-b9s5JkMBE2IQ" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Werewolf</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WFkkPF2wTUVxu2xjh64cF6zkPyeFi1bw/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG</a>), <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rCaib9qunL2rsxck6bKyBTai7glfdTAq/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Demon</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YK92LU3fyIBnSqXtuHoaPxkBc31xPfYj/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Changeling</a> or <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cAq0-M-4Vq9zizkziEv_2z7CiOt3zNj0/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Mummy</a>.<br>
- Also fan splats like <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gyxcHJfVkLbDcMzF9GvvKLcG5shR436e/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Genius</a>, &amp; <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MNISIRkx1Urs6-gcYdcjPpiIeJ4LxJK0/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Leviathan</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1I7ofjT_jKn6-yoNO7Ks932p5Rknbqb-f/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Exalted vs. the World of Darkness</a> crossover with the other, mythic wuxia, White Wolf RPG.<br>
<br>
<u>No Masquerade:</u><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MSjUbnaP4G0DwfVFSh78PrJYhvhrTrmV/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Gods Are Bastards</a> Two paladins, a smart-mouthed demonblood, a dryad, a pixie wizard, a possessed bard, a pirate, and a drow diplomat all go to a college for not!Adventurers - because Adventuring is so archaic in a world of Rail barons and telescrolls - while the bishop of the God of Thieves probes into the secrets the Pantheon have kept from the world for millennia.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1L356FQ99dtqwI7li3MRE4XBkUP75QxvL/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">GURPS Technomancer</a> magic returns in 1945, the US is propeled to greater heights by mystic supremacy.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RAvy-5CJnXinn7E8zEhGisTrA1yaYN_6/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Hidden Legacy</a> paranormal romance. After the world has become a de facto Mageocracy, the Baylor family run a small detective agency in Texas that keeps getting mixed up in high-level magic politics and conspiracies.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1vaxeFUDTOb2cxfnfqVMEU7waaHpC-38k/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">'Mancer</a> novel trilogy. In a world where any sufficiently obsessed person gets reality-altering powers that can backlash hard, the world is firmly against 'mancers. Paul Tsabo, a burecracramancer, gets into production of Flex, a magic luck drug, to get his daughter healed.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CJq7TV1NQcFkpXGZRow6SLSByhtspla_/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Shadow Ops</a> Tacticool military fantasy, where magical Latents are all enslaved by the government and shady corporation Entertech, if not executed for being born with a prohibited magic. Secretly, Entertech produces a drug giving Latents perfect control (uncontrollable magic being part of the scare tactics that let them shred the Constitution) and are colonizing the magical parallel Earth they call the Source. Oscar Britton was already a special forces type when he gets rare and valuable portal magic, and flip-flops <i>hard</i> each chapter between freedom and "oohrah! God and the Dow Jones!" And the sequels get steadily worse.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zK5RiymBquKfSA6b24CI3g2-BZy_F-4o/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Shadowrun</a> &amp; <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1iOFJ-bgRfLTffSCDl7pMxNd5WXxVv3j8/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Sixth World</a> Cyberpunk with magic, the return of which caused chaos and led to the rise of megacorps. You usually play as thieves hired to raid one or another corp by their rivals.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Oqvcj0jcGn2GcdB7nPeWuhJCXCu0kdLY/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Skulduggery Pleasant</a> Stephanie Edgely always loved her uncle's horror and mystery novels, and when he dies and leaves everything to her, the 12-year-old is shocked to discover magic, and uncle Gordon's books are very real, hiring undead PI Skulduggery Pleasant to look into Gordon's death, they go on wisecracking adventures. (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PHHcNUOM88r85_rfIVBWwMCvLJMXSqKw/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a>)<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1i4qvaKMNo29P5GYKciHj5NsEqLm9EBJG/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Wicked + the Divine</a> comic. Every 90 years, the old gods return in a Recurrence, reborn as ordinary humans with extraoridnary powers. They are loved, they are hated, and within two years of manifesting their powers, they are all dead. Most of this is a line, to keep people from wondering at the mysterious death and disappearances of the 'gods.'<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Yr8_MiRD_-GviJKxm0fqNE3whxcfXV1i/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Wish It Inc.</a> A corporation dedicated to the granting of wishes.</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</div><br>


<div class="bbCodeSpoiler">
	<button type="button" class="bbCodeSpoiler-button button--longText button" data-xf-click="toggle" data-xf-init="tooltip" data-original-title="Click to reveal or hide spoiler" id="js-XFUniqueId289"><span class="button-text">

		<span>Spoiler: <span class="bbCodeSpoiler-button-title">Fantasy</span></span>
	</span></button>
	<div class="bbCodeSpoiler-content">
		<div class="bbCodeBlock bbCodeBlock--spoiler">
			<div class="bbCodeBlock-content">Amazing worlds of imagination and magic, full of wonder. Mostly drawn from myth or an idealized vision of history.<br>
<br>
<u>Generic:</u><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/163Eal7CArr2WzD8N0SSOAw81bkyvQQy3/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">80s Sword &amp; Sorcery movies</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1T85DGs5-05YkNRT5tlfoIX4aLbehDbL2/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Generic Builder</a> How do all these dungeons keep getting made? Must be a Builder behind the scenes.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/16pztbxzw1KGJFc_Zse_6njVxdmG67gn9/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Generic Dungeon Core</a> Control a dungeon, grow and try to survive waves of adventurers.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1r2mAIVXqjTonJ_zshhbPOYrAeQuS6ph-/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Generic Dungeon Crawl</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1eWXeaZ3xewDkvX_sCvpQiRK7E8lpZZOE/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Generic Fairy Tale</a> folk tales from around the world.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WW2Mao8kO0OpHZR5NF-GRJErBru9aVH0/view?usp=drivesdk" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Generic Fantasy Academy Otome</a>: A different Otome Isekai replicator. Technically doesn't require an Isekai frame, but the capstone booster is one.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xhvrV7TqI1qGw6F_RGO3fH1eZR6gQt73/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Generic Fantasy RPG</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1K3LDN1PD4cAazUsxqy95DOcoO1uL1Zlf/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Generic Monster School</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xwwJn0VVX_IjdUPxdggN2GINobYCeAwk/view?usp=drivesdk" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Generic Otome Isekai</a>: A generic of the otome genre that owes so much to Bakarina.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/14khQigAj8LT2PPURr9n42rgLcMrPi-1D/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Generic Pathfinder</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1NHuA9xFR0mksGLvbOIKTqQ5SDOfsfcJx/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Generic System Apocalypse</a> This is the way the world ends, not with a bang, but a ding. Everyone becomes a Gamer.<br>
 <br>
<u>Mythology</u>:<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1q3D2FL-skG5X7LqQFvuTwoWJ_4HyxeEt/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Aladdin</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1K5kgqjhuaWFM5M2aFVydLNF-aFEO07JU/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a> about a street-urchin who recovers a magic ring and later a lamp, each with a wish-granting genie.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1IgpUa_2sUXI4vkWU1huEHXGIP1zNfhGl/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Arthurian Myth</a> and <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1rmqtoxEhpNfsqHRVUE3wIoxKIk0-GN1z/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Supplement.</a> The Once and Future King of England. Also famous for his wizard mentor, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zT2HbpUMDYRMv8i4UX6iduofDgM9c0tA/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Merlin</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1r6MGMwGojsoxGC9rXfKgWZAHZu-NP-Cg/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">1998 version)</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RdRx8ydNvv-uP2B64eBxUiyMAJf0sisz/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Knights of Justice</a> Football team is kidnapped from the future to sub in for Arthur and his knights.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wLtgzPzZiHRAkLzXpGEYB1eyjeSOwfbo/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Quest for Camelot</a> A young woman must save Camelot from goons merged with weapons.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xZWq-BPjgd1LyfqgwIB88zbJ3Qf1Z3HI/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Monty Python &amp; the Holy Grail</a> as the legends, but silly.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1eRBvUyZp0J0guBg9Lh-tjjd0DNjNQ7eP/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Chinese Myths</a> including <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1i1Y1wCnHVrX0RD9mBO_xm1bIyZ7LX7i1/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Journey to the West</a> (old <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/148dzIudx9A9PaF_7Ir3yKv3WGVxWP37E/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a>) and <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1F7Fs0Ev-gLFCw0ahupK7psK-KAbWPLpS2cpnAD2qO04/edit" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Romance of the Three Kingdoms</a> <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dLsXWQR0oOjk_jOu7_wvZ_5cxegzBQYY/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Tw7pEDiuIiBin8P-wkE6T0Mlm4aQIRdp/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Investiture of the Gods</a> is a mythologized telling of the transition between the Shang and Zhou dynasties.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/15HTRU5lsukaxONx3BModitilqNecfyb0/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Egyptian Myth</a><br>
<br>
Fate Legends, mythology skillfully retold by Val in the very specific lens of the Nasuverse. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bPA5t0Rg3KOISy4buiRwZZAYpVl8emx7/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Empires of Antiquity</a> Greco-Roman. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hPHDCxVyfEweLXjacFCKCl9RUQQlP3PZ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Garden of Avalon</a> Arthurian and <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UFspKWtbtt1CSY2y5eSBdkgNGf5DMtDf/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">God Save the Queen</a> for British other. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JA9Y5Nk5hMhKr9B9_cp-DHREE-RyCHYj/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Land of Shadows</a> Irish. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Pw3Msd4whQLgAxfL7WHH3gtzJSXxCceW/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Nirvana Yuga</a> Indian. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Um-W_bkJWwykLAdqsoa7IlRmImW8Zci9/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Oasis of Fantasy</a> for Mesopotamian/Middle East. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Sz2owcd2ixawsoyp8GGPvVdobikUGtMk/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Strange New World</a> folklore Americana. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EFLwOberaMVUKHHBuiQvvL-MkueeFp9d/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Land of the Rising Sun</a> Japanese, and thus far AFAIK the only one. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aKc7sZBADFZQ15LqNruuu7J8J-eA9drs/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Vive La France</a> French myth.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/141op2264-iINQfG82qCGXITcwdjc5zTy/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Germanic/Norse Myth</a> such as the <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1RTsCz_0k1AfMBNCZbuU7bLVOC2gbZ78M/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Viking Sagas</a>, and <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Dro70QcakWVTd00gx6mlYQ4C1UzKebrY/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Song of the Nieblungs</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lisshfs2PqJZfH3r_Dia4DSDzbngoUK4/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">2nd version</a>).<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lojbcRvtafwiMYO6CLwJLF6pfzMNxEwY/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Valheim</a> Gauntlet. You play as an einherjar dumped naked into the Tenth World, Valheim, to which Odin banished some of his greatest foes, the Forsaken, so that you can slay them and prevent their recovering enough to be a threat. Prepare for a lot of crafting the tools you need, to get the materials, to forge the weapons, to kill the next boss and unlock the next tier of resources and tools.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1v5DrKB12RWemRYRpmMhYfKRkuLoKIsYv/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Greek Mythology</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WHck8YLlRHJtHXMsn83Kw_PyieH2n8m0/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Reddit</a>)including such tales as <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dnFu0TuYxuy8Bi2gsnRRD2AL3d3GdDJH/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Hercules.</a><br>
- Roman <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lJhXdtBTUvEwuJF6wV3LyXdjT71nR9_m/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Aeneid</a><br>
<br>
Indian myth, besides Nirvana Yuga in Fate, includes the adaptation of the <i>Mahabarata</i> called <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CX1IPVt5A6hALSLy1Q6Ig6iMopM2M9QA/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">18 Days.</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ETNqCaeem559Ryc5dzY6TWcgRdly5LVa/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Irish Myths</a><br>
<br>
Jewish/Caananite Myth. From <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ilho-JJGjg6NOjdbwd6nPTXUa-vqyyTK/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Genesis</a> to <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/19I9nA6377E-7AwkumYnyR3aJHyU6kfBm/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Joseph and the Brothers</a> and <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1d5AZfE5Hx7PRR7lfpQl9QXE73o4l9W66xP9rbRW9ABM/edit" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Prince of Egypt.</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1O0HxDJarxeOfcm1zvPufekUSByLrxyah/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Sinbad the Sailor</a> or if you prefer animation, the <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uuX1HEO6UDSIYaXGwz6xG6z8x3UI2iLu/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dreamworks version</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/13SbN4dGKmNRFLSnT0yh9CGtAcpEz41Dd/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Thailand Myths</a><br>
<br>
<u>High Fantasy:</u> The grand aspect of fantasy. High stakes, high power. Generally fancy. Dark lords and chosen ones all over the place.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/144BiV5ZziWf1x0RjDUyPrs42ejvS5ZgE/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Chronicles of Ancient Darkness</a> Torak, a teen mage in prehistoric times, explores the world and fends off the Soul Eaters.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KMbm8WBIe50vDGMAr31qtq-9tNLOJ_F2/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Clash of the Titans</a> Perseus must slay Medusa, to use her head and save a city from the Kraken.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Hzci-fAhYmUkcb0d2YB-ELV_D4ezUghs/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Deltora Quest</a> Years after the Shadow Lord conquered Deltora and scattered the seven gems of the mystic belt its kings used to ward him off with, street urchin Lief whose parents are definitely not the missing royals, former guardsman Barda and wild-child Jasmine must chase down every terrifying monster in Deltora for the gems in their possession.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1btRx-LnUgujUzRMdFJ3691jvR-xjTD_M/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Krull</a> only the ridiculosuly impractical glaive can protect a distan world from the Beast.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UrdBE4ZyYmqY9V6dLoV8nXOioik88rP5/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Lone Wolf</a> the sole survivor of a sneak attack that wiped out the Kai Lords, an order of warrior-monks given great powers by the sun god Kai, Lone Wolf must learn and grow to avenge his brothers.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CZEVstHgnstK7yMYqPKm6yrimipzdQI5/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Lord of the Rings</a> Frodo Baggins inherits a magical ring, which is evil, and must go to some lengths to destroy it.<br>
- Prequels include <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Yll2QZdOyqzVhrJVqjNjUamhqkYahwLS/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">the Hobbit</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/134krQZmGSC-zpgd9Y30TlOJFL4NyK4ur/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">the Silmarillion</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MIkDTht42zLBxrdMdB4-yzPgiL9bjLqU/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">old TG version</a>), &amp; <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wuOy6O6W6yXFxGWTJfV3LJPT01aCMIp1/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Twilight of the North</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/18ZT69wqm3TkYwbBB55a7Ih-hHZW1occn/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Shadow of Mordor</a> a game series where you play an undead Ranger bound to the ghost of a long-dead elven smith. No matter how many orcs you kill, though, you can't stop what 's coming (and become a ringwraith in the sequel).<br>
<br>
He-Man and the <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nSmNj6xmD7mv0oh_RZU5Vg8rILLBdyGb/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Masters of the Universe</a> on Eternia, the first world to ever develop life, war rages between the peaceful Eternians and the forces of Skeletor. Prince Adam is empowered as He-Man, champion of the Sorceress of Castle Greyskull and protector of its many secrets.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nSmNj6xmD7mv0oh_RZU5Vg8rILLBdyGb/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">She-Ra</a> Prince Adam's sister (at least, in the old continuity) fights with the Princess Rebellion to free the world of Etheria from the Evil Horde.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1b82w5kN1GmDkqPO1ryqw6c1OaErw-ufd/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Stormlight Archives</a> The rest of the Cosmere? Debatable. Stormlight? High flipping family. On a world shaped by storms, a diverse cast of characters must come together and fake being functional humans long enough to save the world from an ancient god of hatred. With the spirit companions who bond to them because of their traumatic backstories, who can turn into swords. Look, if you read it, you get it, if you haven't, what are you waiting for?<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1guKZ6Fx-Zr-Rbpmi1ckm9ZQQbA77pqBO/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Wheel of Time</a> Rand al'Thor is the chosen one, the Dragon Reborn, fated to save <i>and</i> destroy the world in his struggle with the Dark One who corrupted the male half of magic so dudes like Rand always go insane and die. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1AwNAbZw_sxx0D_oqGmGjazrfkVbzUb1p/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Reddit version</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1eqOXgKGDOZ8t3JNvn7IofetSQOw3ommG/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG</a>. Or <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1pizOKrxaySiu2XA1mtpNlNNSee3XMZoe/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The White Tower</a> delivers you about a decade early, in the service of the Aes Sedai, a collective of women mages who say they don't rule the world, but when they care enough effectively rule the world.<br>
- The <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aFKism9lakQxcPdgdEo9tKVWuTBqYA5N/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Trolloc Wars</a> a three-hundred year period of great strife, roughly two thousand years before the main series, which informed much of the world of WoT.<br>
<br>
<u>Heroic Fantasy</u>: the middle ground, fantasy stories that aren't really elevated or crass darkness, they just are.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-efwYJe_gcdBQ4fRfUHQGO7iSfqHgfx_/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">A Practical Guide to Evil</a> A young woman, Catherine Foundling, becomes a Villain and soldier in the Dread Empire oppressing her homeland, in the hopes of making things better in a world dominated by storybook tropes, where some gain roles and powers from the light or dark gods via their Names. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1l6fLWBl2oVnz1xdSyNcOw3zuqU2ZaNb7/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Names supplement</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/13ZQs908ZMwcnFrVNY-c8UbNENwq5LHy7/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">A Throne of Glass</a> In an empire that covered most the continent in an anti-magic field, Caelena is a young assassin (and secret fairy princess) forced into a deadly contest to become the king's personal killer.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JCVAKZ0ndewAzXpDqatRDsCb88cxHnmM/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Arcanum</a> magic vs. industrialization: the RPG.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1PmIy6A9vfzknYh8wd29b7VHNMUzwgCl_/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Avatar</a> in a world divided into nations and tribes based on the elements, which some can control with martial arts, the Avatar is a reincarnating champion who can bend all elements, belong to all peoples and stands for peace and balance. Avatar Aang is frozen for a hundred years, waking to a war-torn world where he is the last Airbender, and has less than a year to master all the elements before the Fire Nation conquers the world. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zWt7QAFZSAfrF8YykrG00pJo0LHXEnhy/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Reddit</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1loSgdFA0Jf_h86BMki6eJj8ctk4_KNto/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">PsychoAnon</a> and <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1f5Hvie9-tMp-wW4mAFfFDyvJYo1HR4TqD7ufxLu3Yb4/edit" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Renegade Chain</a> versions.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nJ-UEcAHzJ_WS7qUV_uvTdrRfAOFEe-U/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Legend of Korra</a> seventy years after the original series, Aang's reincarnation struggles to navigate the complexities of the modern world.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ilYX_4J4cbI06PVvcZypNtorrPQYJMB8/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Beginnings</a> the story of the first Avatar, Wan.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YwdZWYgieEiFYDG0JrwKjhXlIE_Dw_uS/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dawn of Yangchen</a> The airbending Avatar before Aang, in a time when all trade between nations happened in carefully controlled ports managed by corrupt clans.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-QHSYnFC0jDi0Mm5Wm5-YAFD-qCB1tYD/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Rise of Kyoshi</a> Earthbending Avatar, four centuries before the main series, in a time of lawlessness.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aYf8TgfTMVKk_p0zgS3F8uFsZQxBPZA4/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fanfiction</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1w5z8zOxqluzqy5gVgmAd_X7l4ndeHgQN/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Bone</a> Three refugees from a cartoon town wind up across a desert and in a valley where a fantasy epic is going down.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BxE0bQNjUFt-RlJ6BFEx1jf-mA3SGM85/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Choice of the Dragon</a> CYOA story where you play a young dragon and must decide how to obtain a secure lair and a huge pile of gold to hibernate on.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/198lWYix3CKXRBP47eb5H5jRZm8AMem7_/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Chronicles of Ancient Darkness</a> Prehistoric fantasy, after the shamans off each tribe went way off the rails, becoming the Soul Eaters, a young boy, Torak, leaves his tribe meets a wolf spirit companion and a gir, and goes on an epic quest to save the world.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gEftjbDzxoC8VEslzaJsWOZCfcU0Kdz5/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Codex Alera</a> displaced Romans build a society based around their elemental spirits, resist the Marat who form empathic bonds with animals, the Canem wolf-men, and the abominable snow-men of the Far North. Young Tavi is the only Aleran without furycrafting (and the secret heir to the Empire) so gets by with cunning. Unfortunately, a near-brush with war between Aleran and Marat leads him and his future love-interest Kitai to unleash the Vord (think the Zerg and you're basically there).<br>
<br>
The Cosmere. A shared universe of novels by Brandon Sanderson. There was once a god, Aldonalsium, that was murdered and divided into sixteen Shards, taken up by his killers who became like gods themselves. They each emigrated to ten Shardworlds, where their presence created or influenced a novel magic system, or a few. It is possible to traverse these worlds via the Cognitive Realm, usually accessible by Shadpool portals, one on a planet for each Shard.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QU--Kwf7prkhIo9GADqQjRWcDG98JaAL/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Elantris</a> on the massive world of Sel, the Shards Devotion and Domnion were murdered and used to form a magical force called Dor, which can be accessed with martial arts or calligraphy or otherwise dedication to precise forms. Elantris was a city of godlike wizards until an earthquake messed up their mojo, now they cannot cast or heal from their injuries, pain remaining as sharp as the first moment until it drive them mad. One prince will unravel the mysteries of Elantris while forging the gangs into a half-functioning society, while his fiancee tries to help and a missionary prepares for war.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yordaBOB3V3E-yujML83bNuyrDT5QVS_/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">MIstborn</a> Scadriel, world of ash and mist. Settled by opposing Shards Preservation and Ruin. At night the mists come, all day the Ashmounts spew ash into the air. Here magic is invested in 16 metals. Allomancers gain powers by eating and 'burning' metals in their bellies, Feruchemists can bank qualities like strength or wakefulness in jewelry 'metalminds' to retrieve when needed. Qualities can be stolen by spiking someone through the heart with metal, then slapping it in special bind points. Vin has been an orphan thief a long time, but gets wrapped in a peasant revolt with an established crew, and learns she is Mistborn, with all the allomantic powers. (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ISxbgu_4ltGIQwH65SMjBumoOT7opnbR/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG</a>) <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/13T01Zvqs2ISIUlVugI3Toa3ROIGYK-7k/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Wax &amp; Wayne</a> is a sequel series taking place 300 years later, retired lawman and noble Wax is shaken out of retirement to investigate some mysterious robberies/kidnappings.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Sf2Jd_ZNYYDdGtamxNOykh04DfogcmXS/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Stormlight Archives</a> the world of Roshar is defined by the highstorm, a mega-hurricane that circles the world roughly twice a month. And by spren, spirits that appear whenever something changes, fire spren, windspren, fearspren, angerspren. Some humans can bond with spren, gaining power over two fundamental forces (called surges) and becoming Knights Radiant. But they've been gone a long time, along with the Voidbringers they used to fight to save humanity from, but both are returning.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GywTa_WP15DXJskGq1hblINtwbS5x3r1/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Warbreaker</a> Nalthis, settled by Endowment, is a world where everyone has a spark of Breath they can lend out or give away. With enough, you can animate organic matter. Sometimes people come back from the dead in idealized bodies with no memories, but need to eat a Breath a week or they die. Two princesses are swapped on the eve of one's marriage to the God-King of Hallandren. Now perfect daughter Vivi must break all the rules and run off on her own if she's to save wild-child Siri from the terrible decadent Court of Gods. (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/17pcjK323fOv29px2TU36pLvCLQA0dSlI/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Reddit</a>)<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-KMm3kDn30LPpbO7YVXZzJDaW46aEfCo/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dark Lord of Derkholm</a> On a world cruelly enslaved by corporate to churn out adventure tours where Wizard Guides lead a bunch of rubes on an epic quest to slay the Dark Lord and save the world. Well, they're good and sick of it by now, and the oracles tell the assembled VIPs of the world to end the tours by making the first person they say - a failed wizard turned farmer and breeder of impossible creatures - this year's Dark Lord, the organizer of the whole affair.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OTICeQqfKxbAW51F2UTiwWF-vemLUo9k/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Death Gate Cycle</a> In the distant future, the sanctimonious Sartans, one of two races of super-wizards, decided to save the world from their 'evil' cousins the Patryns by dividing it into four elemental planes and a deadly labyrinth to contain and 'educate' their foes. Centuries later, the first Patryns emerge to find the Sartan's experiments in world-building have gone terribly wrong and everything is falling apart.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QC6gToU0UOAMIbsNUThViXCgh3yTPolc/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Demon Souls</a> The original Souls game. Fight to save the fallen kingdom of Boltaria from a demonically corrupted king.<br>
<br>
Diablo. A town is overrun by ancient sealed evil in a classic isometric dungeon crawl game.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1c-ucvG6tb3nogLvswidaupp1XdCxIrQt/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Diablo 3</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0By8NY-NO4-N5RlVxbXZkTXhrSGs/view?resourcekey=0-SpOJ0JkYNwq1-Hzlvb75HA" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Hellfire</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1a-_K-DVl2lz-NdG2OaSPC8hGA9yPycyx/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Discworld</a> Fantasy parody series by Terry Pratchett. It's really, really funny and good.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1y0l5EOSXhksCk4liYe8UO3Sc_NOeduyB/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dragon Age</a> In a world sometimes partially overrun by corrupted Darkspawn, led by a corrupted Dragon, you must convince people to set aside their petty squabbles and fight together for survival. Like herding cats on a good day.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qY-Ti7Y9XjiDnDTT1-HMcZ7fh8JMYWcY/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Inquisition</a> like above, but now you have a demon rift-closing tat and actual authority.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1X3CepsSLwsIMk28Lbce9bsWnZOgRNdt6/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dragonfable</a> Prequel (yet only Jump for) the semi-MMO Adventure Quest.<br>
<br>
Dungeons &amp; Dragons, famed RPG exists in many, many variants. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1T7LdmyTkuMfLmDa4Y_mF4n2f_ZuUtXwj/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">3.5 edition</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cJVWkdiWynS59WYEqjan7EQ_pH4Ux0wl/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Online</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1954TPykhe5QAlap_d0qmFgZHEsHyyieg/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Forgotten Realms</a> aka Faerun, For many of us, still the 'base' setting. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TtDqSRpkbtm1XErYDmV267jLjdNQR23n/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Baldur's Gate</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1TxFX8WAa68vP_YDgknGCgNtM-12YTZ7V/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Blood &amp; Magic</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Z0biVcNk50RCUw0KaMUE-MqW2p9AM_Ai/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Neverwinter Nights</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KivK5W8G9g8pLx82YkZVQMvLk8ATDeKF/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Storm of Zehir</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jQRzaZ1XDFZe8w7mctvR9d4EtosyUMPF/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Icewind Dale</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JREDszJ5wpCyrjEcPU8AwLE_9HPSHBTQ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Mystara</a> the other 'basic' setting.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Jj2_i7Hf5o3mdzv2U2aC5KNDB2gSyjfP/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dark Sun</a> A brutal, dying world.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1w-HCtCH8ycOkhQ5nyYE_InYWZ_Vj5aMc/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dragonlance</a> the one abandoned by the gods, where returning dragons can be killed only by the titular weapon.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oINTw5XXzTUSbsGoOo8FrCW1ZI7v0mYe/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Eberron</a> The one where low-level magic is really, really common.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/10HZ0UHE0zgVJnVUy8Lp3TdnPpKNAF7XJ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Midnight</a> world where evil <i>won</i> and magic is practically nonexistent.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fAuFb8s9k1kd0j-niu8DTLoHWTQ2IiGg/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Ravenloft</a> the Demiplane of Dread, where the worst monsters languish in self-made hells.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1thvJONLWpVv6dLVABWb1E0HhC7L2R6mN/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Spelljammer</a> D&amp;D IN SPAAACE!!<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KiXAKGyQQrll9zgl2UhvRl3Dejf9_jtl/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dragons</a> No specific setting, just a Jump built around being a dragon.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1b3kBWGs90VAZr3skKGZPpeyRxHxS4KK7/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Drow</a> evil underground elves.<br>
- Lords of the Night, Jumps about playing undead, like <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bSNOA3vrY3vDxWwL2pWfavQgM1F98kW2/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Liches</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/13q8b6wh80R6lm9fg5jp_TRc3nTD62fd2/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Vampires</a> and <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GyaHiMwHo4Tq0cni-LBjnT8Cqg6qXw2W/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Zombies</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1NTyiKg8v3j4n21GI_RzcT2LXPomOYhAP/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Mystic</a> 5th edition psions.<br>
- Fanworks including: <a href="https://docs.google.com/file/d/1oliBeomTG25JP4F6JWNQECSJulvERjY1/edit?filetype=msword" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Critical Role</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uk3wn3RGsPHBcCPpqorSwpbYp3ebAlkt/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dungeons &amp; Daddies</a> (podcast with four dads flung into the Forgotten Realms to rescue their children), <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nnF6GQaXX-QkRn21dOkRGIm78VyuJsiI/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Not Another D&amp;D Podcast</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jT4uSMsJauaKmEx5MEnB08GApNpgiSvi/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Order of the Stick</a>, &amp; <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1r8bZio4XAtAFVFfLw4QLhOIz2ZLMrT4C/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Tome of Radiance</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1OG9NMPkZWwXtsbI5ryMjccoLSuXyrGdp/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Earthsea</a> A world of many small islands, where a prodigious mage, Ged, gets in way over his head but learns wisdom by it, becoming a great wizard and the mentor to other heroes.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/19kD6dH_pFbrBz6cMxRJEBmA9BSlARREh/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Enchanted Forest Chronicles</a> an inappropriately tomboyish and scholarly princess runs away from home, becomes housemaid to a clutch of dragons, meets many quirky characters.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1qulGlwbDZIiw4uISLufNxoRETIatRmJy/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fable</a> Decide what kind of hero you want to be.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WwxALgmqbRputrGCACqvtgf769comxlN/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fables: part one</a> In the Fables comic, fairy tale beings hide in New York, having been driven from the interconnected multiverse they call the Homelands. This Jump, first of a planned pair, is a prequel taking place in said Homelands.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MSjUbnaP4G0DwfVFSh78PrJYhvhrTrmV/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Gods are Bastards</a> Fantasy Western. Arachne Tellwyrn, an elven archmage, opens a college for adventurers while Antonio Darling, Bishop of the Eserite Order (Thieves Guild) spins plates at the highest level of religious and imperial politics, driven to investigate a lost secret of the Pantheon.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1XRyqE072zcmFGFuSn5Eq11wnbPayBFkc/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Gone</a> A forcefield covers an area, all adults vanish and the kids get superpowers.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1USHLQTbcvYgX8FY5uThtt1uYmIUyhwxB/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Jonathan Strange &amp; Mr. Norrell</a> during the Napoleonic Wars, two gentlemen attempt to revive the English magical tradition.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1MSEIt3CNS4IQCgGpf8EGmgRigtPdQFDn/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Legend of Zelda</a> long-running game series with at least three canon timelines. You play as Link, on a quest to (most of the time) save Princess Zelda from the evil Gannondorf. Sometimes there's another threat, usually a cover for Gannondorf, but there's at least three games without him, and one even without Zelda.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1u-683KhW2kQ87LR90mIsw8m7-nznRw0u/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Skyward Sword</a> LoZ on flying islands.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uuXkpeCFzgDt3Arlz7X7YlVPS0uW0rh5/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Minish Cap</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Uy2vxRS90TRYhhfyHopKgW9JoSYKiHIM/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Original game</a> gauntlet. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DNGXSlwdlJ9AKZXL_fObvjL2aKuzvsJ5/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Adventures of Link</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1XznCLmmJXN0sdDUe5rgnsJ3F0j_bMmH_/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Ancient Stone Tablets</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HNrfE5pcX2HMMhMjpCuZV_vLCoaLo0gk/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Phillips CDi</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HjrsFVrz4EDmiSJfgNSSJOSLKjvtuY6E/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Ocarina of Time</a> first N64, fully 3D Zelda. Link switches between an idyllic present and dark and fallen future using the titular instrument.<br>
- Fallen Hero timeline, where a triumphant Gannondorf is sealed. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jey7vNH_1OS9O3MxC82Qzjvu4HK6FLAx/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">A Link to the Past</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/14ZUC6kUrw6J9GADA3WM1D2eEqTRrUz_W/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Link's Awakening</a> Link washes up on an island (that technically doesn't exist) which he must escape. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/18Dd11WR29AhVWeyjEPRpcg1LbdLDMd0X/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Oracle of Seasons</a> where Link must protect Din. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1C1YCI_EP7XBbHgwgqjD0azHY2b1XHXyz/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Oracle of Ages</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1a6SfTa4TO6F1HoVCzKyJR-NxN9qGSFbK/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">A Link between Worlds</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sWqhTZIF3g0WTH2rHlOnSTPOHjqRvOB1/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Triforce Heroes</a>,<br>
- Child timeline, as per the ending cutscene of Ocarina, child Link and Zelda warn off the King about Gannondorf and avert disaster. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1k50cF0Nk6pfSIj5IAG07mI0cwPr1mK-X/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Majora's Mask</a> the follow-up where the moon is falling and Link has three days to stop it, using a variety of masks to gain powers and change form. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/134v37vlp1wdyORQoSasysFrSxrCPQg00/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Twlight Princess</a> Link is turned into a wolf, Zelda is possessed, new friend Midna is a gremlin. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CzXQcLBvZkp8Pk5AIueRxA_2ycufstei/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Four Swords</a> <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1t4h8zbPLMZnQpK264OkPKysR3__c01d1/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">second Jump</a> Gannondorf unleashes an army with a dark mirror.<br>
- Adult Timeline where Link disappears, Gannondorf is sealed. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1QmSKxFdWfi0qVIrgAYcCjqCNraSO97mf/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Wind Waker</a> Hyrule is flooded, Gannondorf kidnap's Link's sister. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wpgindKmoRqQ7V6AUzpmxmCdBq_AQe9z/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Phantom Hourglass</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jqVUeVDdsGyD2mwHbZmgLXC3b3dw4V3S/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Spirit Tracks</a>.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1C94XZw_6tMtuzC6MbUiQyHssFjPuW5pz/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Hyrule Warriors</a> siege by an evil Sorceress. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1t7ZNeQC23FNSxly5MzVwpKdCkXMZtAtp/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Age of Calamity</a> like baseline Hyrule Warriors, but also a prequel for BOTW.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1x0lpzJhl02SGKvz5U9VFcOkE5FDGO1-G/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Breath of the Wild</a> Link wakes from a century slumber to find Hyrule destroyed and Zelda barely containing Calamity Ganon to the castle. (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Klgx0hdRAOJUSodD1_eT8WLRtcFAXU_Q/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG version</a>) <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DPolM3G1LK6_hRnE4KNdZOk0_mz2EcYM/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Again</a> a BOTW fanfic with Link trapped in a time-loop.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/18C8SaqRFwaZZmZL7gmhN_aHqrJ9IvbWD/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Cadence of Hyrule</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YJ4LyTkzFppkFksELwFNut7_dXpPsFHO/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Triune Scriptures</a> Zelda as cultivation.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/17wJohxwgXhl3vYYBmeG0ouBPkJn6Vupu/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">A Fist Full of Rupees</a> Zelda as Spaghetti Western.<br>
- Fan/Parodies, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/14wWygG10a2HSSRsR0IPkcWkK-vKZwSa8/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Average Zelda</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ln9YwV6hz5CDAGB0mGsMvHxiUh6UthM5/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Adventures of Lunk</a>, <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/11V8FWze-RE6GNXpmcIlUQuRO14vCS5Q6/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Legend of Neil</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UrdBE4ZyYmqY9V6dLoV8nXOioik88rP5/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Lone Wolf</a> The last survivor of the Kai Lords, an order of Jedi/Ranger/Monks, swears vengeance on the Darklords who slew his brothers, goes on a series of gamebook adventures. A different series of books also set in Magnamund follows Grey Star, a young wizard, on a quest to defeat a rogue member of the group of immortal sorcerers who taught him.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wB9dA34EG4Ia15zqbRdNPfWFsFzTilmD/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Magicka</a> An adventure of sorts, a tale of wizards and... wizards in different colored robes?<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1SvOkhpUuvum4gNZzAfn_F4smw7Z0CyKd/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Mother of Learning</a> Zorian is a magic student who gets caught in a different (handsome, powerful and noble) student's time-loop. Later turns out to be an NPC in a magitek simulation.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_hY_CZcxV5JsxPixmjwKTCQc743njtKo/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Nexus</a> A plane at the broken edges of reality, where all kinds of things fall through the cracks. Was never quite sure if this was an RPG, a story, exclusive to Jumpchain. But it does have a large number of other <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1liFEpvNm9lVezN7hZyb_uswUaavDqzjh/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Planes</a> to explore.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1lboZGJPe5GN85xQXHmK3YCo-5P3KpWBe/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Betwixt</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1eHyj0RQHR2bjmzYa0YBVzbON_SEb8Q6V/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">D'void</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Y8NMp0X4faFcNzbzuiklgpIrSJs9--S9/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fortuna</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1vVFYgKIoHViGiGwWebWlAj4tpNRvZYbC/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Paradise</a><br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ah2M_LGvO0doRcF5bnMAxqSChOuAUcDs/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Pathfinder</a>, not D&amp;D, but basically D&amp;D. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/14khQigAj8LT2PPURr9n42rgLcMrPi-1D/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Generic</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jzrst_Ots68j_fTTGziovpLczyJJQhxm/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Kingmaker</a><br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1U3SKRRseGL4SDOG6IAayxdp19owfvBYh/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Wrath of the Righteous</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1hm_hcLEplP_-sKejovTCKXjJjYk44L1U/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Pirates of the Caribbean</a> Cursed aztec gold and undead pirates bring together some unlikely allies, and then things get complicated. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mAQgUYwJKUyO3UnFg0l2th41E9-_Nuqr/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dead Men Tell No Tales</a> Will's child attempts to free him from captaincy of the Flying Dutchman.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ff5j77ghGpmiE6f8u-QDsKr9rgfyoHjg/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Runepunk</a> RPG set in a steampunk magitek City, cast adrift between dimensions, besieged by demons and internal threats.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1fPHcO6PvOGCvmFTnnXi3mKDdFT3p1n32/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Secret Texts</a> A trainee diplomat and secret werewolf, Kait, barely escapes a purge of her noble family. Seeking the means to restore the dead from dreams of her grandmother, she accidentally unleashes the sorcerous god-kings who ruined the world a thousand years ago. Oops.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/10gUPsh2FtI0PVtD4ZLtD_JyJ6eoJf--v/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Spirit of the North</a> A fox cleanses the corrupted ecosystem.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/161fCWl9y1CSP1ihDyL2OXUwBKQ7OoYkA/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">UnFamiliar</a> The first commoner student at a magical academy attempts suicide, instead makes a familiar bond with an immortal Arch-Lich bound outside the universe.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ZItAzz95mXGi4PUFmMaGk80HlkNDNFfc/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Witchlands</a> A century of war for the Wells from which Witches derive their power is put on hold for a couple decades, but war is breaking out early with the discovery of a Truthwitch, Safiya fon Hasstrel, much desired by all parties. She and her thread-sister Iseult are the reincarnating Cahr Awen who can fix the broken Wells.<br>
<br>
<u>Low Fantasy:</u> A more 'grounded' approach to how awful the past could be. Expect moral complexity, magic and magical races/creatures will be vanishingly rare if they even exist.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1C4Ndsih0E63ym2ZcVvMLL4potw8rvg-B/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">A Song of Ice &amp; Fire</a> Ned Stark is called to become Hand of the King (think chancellor or vizier) after the last dies mysteriously, his widow writing to Ned's wife of a sinister conspiracy. Meanwhile his children all want to grow up too fast, they'll get their chance, and a princess of the recently deposed dynasty dreams of her glorious return.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nLyZQ55TszXCo6CkAdKmTGWDrzvvAXe_/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Game of Thrones</a> the popular (until they ran out of material to adapt!) TV version.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1BsPqieyxaTkFE1vREDhPo5G2UNFGIWSo/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Seven Kingdoms</a> a prequel set in the time of Aegon's Conquest.<br>
- <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/11hYobfKzXVRtMeZdrKEBMAKpB7yesLMWCeFeUuEPmG0/edit#" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Fanfiction</a><br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B1qb0_OLhDrDSV9oRGRRVHZfQU0/view?resourcekey=0-ItKyauIgXyNzc7n-exzzqw" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Berserk</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GLRi6VjZFvtdXp1DWzS5r5m0HdRiCCrp/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Unofficial Redux</a>) Guts the Black Swordsman never believed in anyone or anything until he found true companions in the <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xHTkxhgYjCypeqO40iAggFd3wXd8qAbKwkmYwp0vHfI/edit" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Band of the Hawk</a>, which lasts until their leader Griffith betrayed the group, offering them up as sacrifices so he could ascend and become a demon lord, now called Femto. Still branded as a sacrifice, demons are drawn to Guts as his every night becomes a struggle for survival and vengeance.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1M91UlDafpAWINntxhld_tk64pDyedDb-/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Ironsworn</a> a low to no magic Viking fantasy RPG. Ironsworn make a sacred vow on a beloved weapon or armorpiece to fulfill a perilous quest.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/12agOhI1kZq2E0zySISbihRRdk5MdTTy-/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Mount &amp; Blade</a> be a mercenary captain/warlord in the ongoing struggle to reunite fractured Calradia.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1k5yeqIc74i-66ajfr07tDCmxBIJ5Q_0K/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Powder Mage</a> A lot more magic than most examples, but certainly grim and gritty.
