Field Marshal Tamas of Adro and his circle of gunpowder mages stage a coup and effectively the fantasy French Revolution in his native kingdom of Adro, triggering the return of vengeful gods. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1H15cj5wr-P98mdCMFjK83ZplcTO8SvCI/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Gods of Blood and Powder</a> is a sequel series taking part a decade later in Fastrasta.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/19wTbBNRzyF4ziXWmpZldpFQLjqeidV8K/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Prince of Nothing</a> In the fantasy Crusades, yet bloodier and bleaker, a chosen leader appears, raised from birth to be hyper-intelligent, observant and run on pure logic. He will save and damn the world.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/16_plG_i978UYEqKEPsC5X3-qK7CLOt3X/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">UnReal World</a><br>
<br>
Warhammer Fantasy Battles - wargame and novels, generic fantasy setting but everyone can constantly fight everyone else. And magic comes from the daemonic Realm of Chaos. <a href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/11hYobfKzXVRtMeZdrKEBMAKpB7yesLMWCeFeUuEPmG0/edit#" target="_blank" class="link link--external" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1CPKijy4dmDh2DFJTspPB4h52Hc3ZJKc2/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Mummies Alive!</a> <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1EPxv34GCdaG7Fz8VKs_T3n3XQ0tfRplN/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Rats</a>, there are <a Yer a <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1x0z3HHmiw7Sq6ub7cloBdwwMIXSoxBTO/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Wizard</a> 'Arry.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1NgBL2enTZUnYVFCV5Rtpb8K5cRwYmrKf/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Mercenaries</a> who you'd think would be the smart ones here, but pretty much un-Jumpable.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1w-vXkakFpI7bGKhSeSrkvbBZnZcNON_F/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Age of Sigmar</a>, a sequel series where the Old World was rebooted into a loosely associated collective of themed planes. Ulgu, the realm of shadows contains an elven <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1YyG2k7uBKkIA0zGMrFO1pAFJPQN6CPOv/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">feminist murder cult</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1mCwOrLYjIeRwjiiGijhM7O9qLr1pC5Jr/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Witcher</a> Geralt of Rivia hunts monsters for coin, is forced to become guardian to a fugitive princess whom <i>everybody</i> wants to have a baby with. Like geez, guys, cool it! In the <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/14c_IzhK-W83IVkyoMA12Pw_O4QWqZxoF/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Games</a> an amnesic Geralt returns from his death at the end of the books.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ot34Nguvbf4c-wOMOMuV2u3u1soG1v-_/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Nightmare of the Wolf</a> is a prequel focusing on Geralt's mentor, Vesemir, and the destruction of Kaer Morhen.<br>
<br>
<u>Isekai:</u> Stories of people transported from our ordinary world to an extraordinary and fantastical one. Earliest ones tended to be all about getting home, a lot of more recent (mostly Japanese) tales focus more on the transplant being utterly awesome in their new setting.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1d4ah7e20gRxoZe1kWLwRXf_-1xBPdEQQ/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">A Princess of Mars</a> Civil War veteran John Carter is whisked away to Mars, Barsoom in the local tongue, for an adventure.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1cYU_mL1rWKZllpuoGlcucBIaEbawx8gR/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Alice's Adventures in Wonderland</a> Alice Liddel falls through a rabbit hole to a topsy-turvy world of obscure logic. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1I-BNaz6NoJ-MlzXjyqKfE9HfjF4S61ol/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Through the Looking Glass</a> the sequel.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FExZQ-gK6dmPwnPQnh1fT3MqOLv3pRQy/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">American McGee's Alice</a> A horror game based on the above.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/17oWwqBH54QTjqZ80l_6Mo5S_MU1fWbQx/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">JAGS Wonderland</a> horror RPG based on Alice.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1NqFPu82VSHAgmPFVKDHk1H9LWY2_dgKE/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Madness Returns</a> <i>another</i> horror game.<br>
- <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/12N2TVb_n7pJp4s5rQcC2Yaf0Ryzo8xsR/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Wonderland No More</a> much lighter, still serious RPG.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1JYoSkdJx2zQ4o2yKeHB0f6pAyct_ngvp/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Arifueta</a> - Edgy boy and the harem that follow him.<br>

<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/19B02dyP6fgcOrBmYgkrVwe9hWBAmnEfk/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Centaurworld</a> A horse from a wartorn low-fantasy setting is accidentally portaled to a sugar bowl (but with crass humor). <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Aom-4SQFA5eBwwYxP49Wta9lzr683hz6/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">TG</a> version.<br>

<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/13nGSzvh41xC4A5mB1YOm6qwKi-Fc480A/view?usp=drivesdk" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Completionist Chronicles</a> A quadriplegic is offered a new life as a permanent player in a VRMMO game, which turns out to be not so virtual.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1wdVBzMvHyV5omTKo7YBTUwHOe7Q96p27/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Daniel Black</a> A marine from our world is sent to another where all the gods and legends are real, as the champion of Hecate. Keep meaning to actually read this one.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-KMm3kDn30LPpbO7YVXZzJDaW46aEfCo/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Dark Lord of Derkholm</a> Forty years ago, Roland Chensey discovered how to open portals to a world of magic. He immediately set out to monetize his discovery, turning the Other Side into a theme park where rubes cough up their life-savings to spend a few weeks roughing it with a Wizard hauling them this way and that over the countryside until they can defeat the Dark Lord and save the world. And the locals are thoroughly sick of it. The huge pointless battles, the dramatic sacking of cities while parties of Tourists barely escape, the despoiled wastelands and periodic renaming of things to sound more 'fantasy.' All of it. A council of kings and great names consult the oracles, who say to end the tours they must name a failed wizard and breeder of fantastic creatures, Wizard Derk, as the Dark Lord.<br>

Everyone else is trying to figure out this new faction while he's just roleplaying his chunni edgelord fantasies.<br>

From there he visits: Harry Potter, the MCU + Fox X-Men movies, Bleach and more. Each time getting a new overpowered ability, and a mission, and 2-3 new harem members. Eventually revealed to be 'God's' counterpart, an omnipotent force of cosmic destruction divided endlessly and reclaiming his lost powers as he goes.<br>

<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-2O__7MmjJWchouyiqnqc0o1jaO5CMpD/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Rising of the Shield Hero</a> (<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1x_rbEMqxGkK4EwzKmTHwigyp0H4xy8xh/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">WN</a>)- Guy get summoned, accused of rape, and is made a pariah in two days. In his angst, decides to buy a child and make it fight for him, really turning that reputation around.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1XAwq-DiR6kxHvp0zN79feF8y68dr95w_/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Tavern In Another World</a> Alan is transported to a fantasy world with the ability to upgrade it as he completes quests and achievements, bringing more and more modern world influences.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Hrys_k5Wjq1Tgs31jLQZIwqsVGpQht0E/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">That Time I Was Reincarnated as a Slime</a> A man is reborn as the weakest of monsters, a Slime. <a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1bzViIsq-FO3hgdvOrYaaKnlXF848B94q/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Anime version</a>.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1x-i_UJG7pxmFbV7l6FAAxReb62OEnm5-/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">There is No Epic Loot Here, Only Puns</a> Delta (original name unknown even to her) becomes a Dungeon Core in a fantasy world. Despite the prompting of her menus or the strangely capable locals begging her to invest in lethal self-defense, she becomes determined to be a pacifist and not a muder-hole at all.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1-f-TVvwgdT1LDcIVKUS1KGs7BU-d_1p_/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Turok</a> dinosaur hunter and protector of the Lost Land. May or may not be an isekai, Turok's continuity is... complicated.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1nQX485qyPqzmDGWWXI4eQRoKRvRF_xgp/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The Wandering Inn</a> Erin Solstice finds herself in a game-like world with the class of [innkeeper] and so repairs her defunct building into an inn, drawing all kinds of characters.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1GbVnZ1Qh59nLfLM6UUzJ-OA8H_jN69rP/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">With This Ring</a> Fanfic SI. A nerd from our world wakes on the moon orbiting the DC (Young Justice) Earth with no memory of the canon series, unable to say or think his name (Paul) and with an Orange Lantern ring on his hand.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1ejOMRrPuFETn0qUcofuYDjps6aN6iUup/view?usp=drivesdk" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">The World of Otome is tough for mobs</a>: After playing a Otome game for his sister and buying a cheat item, a man is inserted into the world of the Otome as a minor character. Discovering the setting is heavily misandrist, he picks up the cheat item and then he picks a fight with the elite princes, but against his own wishes finds himself rising in the ranks and getting further entangled in politics.<br>
<br>
<a href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aJcoUaRUm3SvuK5QCtxckltU1L24D2JX/view" target="_blank" class="link link--external" rel="nofollow ugc noopener">Youjo Senki - the Saga of Tanya the Evil</a> Time freezes as a Japanese salaryman is murdered, and he has an interesting chat with a being that claims to be God, though he insists on calling it 'Being X'. Hurt that the atheist businessman won't worship him, X decides to see what it would take, having him reborn as a little girl, and a mage, in a setting where magic exists and about to undergo their equivalent to WWI.</div>
